title: Pellucidar

text: DEAR SIR: I think that I have run across one of the most remarkable
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: coincidences in modern literature.  But let me start at the beginning:
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I am, by profession, a wanderer upon the face of the earth.  I have no
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trade--nor any other occupation.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My father bequeathed me a competency; some remoter ancestors lust to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: roam.  I have combined the two and invested them carefully and without
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extravagance.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I became interested in your story, At the Earth's Core, not so much
title: Pellucidar

text: because of the probability of the tale as of a great and abiding wonder
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

text: Shortly thereafter I started for the Sahara in search of a rather rare
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: species of antelope that is to be found only occasionally within a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: limited area at a certain season of the year.  My chase led me far from
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the haunts of man.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was a fruitless search, however, in so far as antelope is concerned;
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but one night as I lay courting sleep at the edge of a little cluster
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of date-palms that surround an ancient well in the midst of the arid,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shifting sands, I suddenly became conscious of a strange sound coming
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apparently from the earth beneath my head.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was an intermittent ticking!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: notes.  I lay for an hour--listening intently.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last my curiosity got the better of me.  I arose, lighted my lamp
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and commenced to investigate.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My bedding lay upon a rug stretched directly upon the warm sand.  The
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noise appeared to be coming from beneath the rug.  I raised it, but
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found nothing--yet, at intervals, the sound continued.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I dug into the sand with the point of my hunting-knife.  A few inches
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the feel of wood beneath the sharp steel.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Excavating about it, I unearthed a small wooden box.  From this
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: receptacle issued the strange sound that I had heard.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: How had it come here?
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: What did it contain?
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In attempting to lift it from its burying place I discovered that it
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seemed to be held fast by means of a very small insulated cable running
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: farther into the sand beneath it.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My first impulse was to drag the thing loose by main strength; but
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fortunately I thought better of this and fell to examining the box.  I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: soon saw that it was covered by a hinged lid, which was held closed by
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a simple screwhook and eye.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It took but a moment to loosen this and raise the cover, when, to my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: utter astonishment, I discovered an ordinary telegraph instrument
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: clicking away within.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What in the world," thought I, "is this thing doing here?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: explanation, when one took into account the loneliness and remoteness
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the spot.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They meant nothing to me then.  I was baffled.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instrument, I moved the sending-key up and down a few times.  Instantly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as a little boy--but time had obliterated it from my memory.  I became
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for which this clicking instrument might stand.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: succor.  The very franticness of the instrument's wild clashing

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: betokened something of the kind.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And there sat I, powerless to interpret, and so powerless to help!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I arrived here today.  In writing you this letter I feel that I am

text: CHAPTER II
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: TRAVELING WITH TERROR
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We made camp there beside the peaceful river.  There Perry told me all
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that had befallen him since I had departed for the outer crust.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It seemed that Hooja had made it appear that I had intentionally left
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian behind, and that I did not purpose ever returning to Pellucidar.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He told them that I was of another world and that I had tired of this
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and of its inhabitants.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To Dian he had explained that I had a mate in the world to which I was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returning; that I had never intended taking Dian the Beautiful back
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with me; and that she had seen the last of me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Shortly afterward Dian had disappeared from the camp, nor had Perry
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seen or heard aught of her since.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He had no conception of the time that had elapsed since I had departed,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but guessed that many years had dragged their slow way into the past.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hooja, too, had disappeared very soon after Dian had left.  The
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sarians, under Ghak the Hairy One, and the Amozites under Dacor the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Strong One, Dian's brother, had fallen out over my supposed defection,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for Ghak would not believe that I had thus treacherously deceived and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deserted them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The result had been that these two powerful tribes had fallen upon one
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: another with the new weapons that Perry and I had taught them to make
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and to use.  Other tribes of the new federation took sides with the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: original disputants or set up petty revolutions of their own.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The result was the total demolition of the work we had so well started.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Taking advantage of the tribal war, the Mahars had gathered their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: succession, wreaking awful havoc among them and reducing them for the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: most part to as pitiable a state of terror as that from which we had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raised them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Alone of all the once-mighty federation the Sarians and the Amozites
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a few other tribes continued to maintain their defiance of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that any attempt at re-amalgamation would be made.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: First Empire of Pellucidar."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vile act of the treacherous Hooja had torn down.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So now he set himself to work to build a scientific canoe.  I had

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crew under javelin-fire--the lofty sides made an admirable shelter.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of cities, and so on down the line.  Therefore, we decided to name the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first battle-ship Sari, after the first of the federated kingdoms.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The launching of the Sari proved easier than I contemplated.  Perry
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wanted me to get in and break something over the bow as she floated
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out upon the bosom of the river, but I told him that I should feel
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: safer on dry land until I saw which side up the Sari would float.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could see by the expression of the old man's face that my words had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hurt him; but I noticed that he didn't offer to get in himself, and so
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I felt less contrition than I might otherwise.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When we cut the ropes and removed the blocks that held the Sari in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: place she started for the water with a lunge.  Before she hit it she
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was going at a reckless speed, for we had laid our tracks quite down to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the water, greased them, and at intervals placed rollers all ready to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: receive the ship as she moved forward with stately dignity.  But there
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was no dignity in the Sari.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When she touched the surface of the river she must have been going
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: twenty or thirty miles an hour.  Her momentum carried her well out into
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the stream, until she came to a sudden halt at the end of the long line
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which we had had the foresight to attach to her bow and fasten to a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: large tree upon the bank.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The moment her progress was checked she promptly capsized.  Perry was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: overwhelmed.  I didn't upbraid him, nor remind him that I had "told him
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: His grief was so genuine and so apparent that I didn't have the heart
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to reproach him, even were I inclined to that particular sort of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: meanness.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Come, come, old man!" I cried.  "It's not as bad as it looks.  Give me
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a hand with this rope, and we'll drag her up as far as we can; and then
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when the tide goes out we'll try another scheme.  I think we can make a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: go of her yet."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Well, we managed to get her up into shallow water.  When the tide
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: receded she lay there on her side in the mud, quite a pitiable object
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the premier battle-ship of a world--"the terror of the seas" was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the way Perry had occasionally described her.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We had to work fast; but before the tide came in again we had stripped
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her of her sails and masts, righted her, and filled her about a quarter
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: full of rock ballast.  If she didn't stick too fast in the mud I was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sure that she would float this time right side up.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I can tell you that it was with palpitating hearts that we sat upon the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: river-bank and watched that tide come slowly in.  The tides of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidar don't amount to much by comparison with our higher tides of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the outer world, but I knew that it ought to prove ample to float the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sari.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nor was I mistaken.  Finally we had the satisfaction of seeing the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vessel rise out of the mud and float slowly upstream with the tide.  As
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the water rose we pulled her in quite close to the bank and clambered
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aboard.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She rested safely now upon an even keel; nor did she leak, for she was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: well calked with fiber and tarry pitch.  We rigged up a single short
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mast and light sail, fastened planking down over the ballast to form a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deck, worked her out into midstream with a couple of sweeps, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dropped our primitive stone anchor to await the turn of the tide that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would bear us out to sea.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: While we waited we devoted the time to the construction of an upper
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deck, since the one immediately above the ballast was some seven feet
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from the gunwale.  The second deck was four feet above this.  In it was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a large, commodious hatch, leading to the lower deck.  The sides of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ship rose three feet above the upper deck, forming an excellent
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: breastwork, which we loopholed at intervals that we might lie prone and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fire upon an enemy.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Though we were sailing out upon a peaceful mission in search of my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: friend Ja, we knew that we might meet with people of some other island
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: who would prove unfriendly.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last the tide turned.  We weighed anchor.  Slowly we drifted down
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the great river toward the sea.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: About us swarmed the mighty denizens of the primeval deep--plesiosauri
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ichthyosauria with all their horrid, slimy cousins whose names were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as the names of aunts and uncles to Perry, but which I have never been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: able to recall an hour after having heard them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last we were safely launched upon the journey to which we had looked
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forward for so long, and the results of which meant so much to me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: CHAPTER IV
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: FRIENDSHIP AND TREACHERY
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Sari proved a most erratic craft.  She might have done well enough
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon a park lagoon if safely anchored, but upon the bosom of a mighty
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ocean she left much to be desired.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sailing with the wind she did her best; but in quartering or when
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: close-hauled she drifted terribly, as a nautical man might have guessed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she would.  We couldn't keep within miles of our course, and our
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: progress was pitifully slow.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Instead of making for the island of Anoroc, we bore far to the right,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until it became evident that we should have to pass between the two
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: right-hand islands and attempt to return toward Anoroc from the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: opposite side.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we neared the islands Perry was quite overcome by their beauty.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When we were directly between two of them he fairly went into raptures;
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nor could I blame him.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The tropical luxuriance of the foliage that dripped almost to the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: water's edge and the vivid colors of the blooms that shot the green
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: made a most gorgeous spectacle.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry was right in the midst of a flowery panegyric on the wonders of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the peaceful beauty of the scene when a canoe shot out from the nearest
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: island.  There were a dozen warriors in it; it was quickly followed by
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a second and third.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Of course we couldn't know the intentions of the strangers, but we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could pretty well guess them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry wanted to man the sweeps and try to get away from them, but I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: soon convinced him that any speed of which the Sari was capable would
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be far too slow to outdistance the swift, though awkward, dugouts of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Mezops.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I waited until they were quite close enough to hear me, and then I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hailed them.  I told them that we were friends of the Mezops, and that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we were upon a visit to Ja of Anoroc, to which they replied that they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were at war with Ja, and that if we would wait a minute they'd board us
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and throw our corpses to the azdyryths.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I warned them that they would get the worst of it if they didn't leave
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us alone, but they only shouted in derision and paddled swiftly toward
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us.  It was evident that they were considerably impressed by the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appearance and dimensions of our craft, but as these fellows know no
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fear they were not at all awed.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Seeing that they were determined to give battle, I leaned over the rail
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the Sari and brought the imperial battle-squadron of the Emperor of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidar into action for the first time in the history of a world.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In other and simpler words, I fired my revolver at the nearest canoe.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The effect was magical.  A warrior rose from his knees, threw his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: paddle aloft, stiffened into rigidity for an instant, and then toppled
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: overboard.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The others ceased paddling, and, with wide eyes, looked first at me and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then at the battling sea-things which fought for the corpse of their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: comrade.  To them it must have seemed a miracle that I should be able
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to stand at thrice the range of the most powerful javelin-thrower and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a loud noise and a smudge of smoke slay one of their number with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: an invisible missile.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But only for an instant were they paralyzed with wonder.  Then, with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: savage shouts, they fell once more to their paddles and forged rapidly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward us.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Again and again I fired.  At each shot a warrior sank to the bottom of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the canoe or tumbled overboard.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When the prow of the first craft touched the side of the Sari it
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: contained only dead and dying men.  The other two dugouts were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approaching rapidly, so I turned my attention toward them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I think that they must have been commencing to have some doubts--those
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wild, naked, red warriors--for when the first man fell in the second
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boat, the others stopped paddling and commenced to jabber among
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: themselves.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The third boat pulled up alongside the second and its crews joined in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the conference.  Taking advantage of the lull in the battle, I called
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out to the survivors to return to their shore.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I have no fight with you," I cried, and then I told them who I was and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: added that if they would live in peace they must sooner or later join
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forces with me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Go back now to your people," I counseled them, "and tell them that you
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have seen David I, Emperor of the Federated Kingdoms of Pellucidar, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that single-handed he has overcome you, just as he intends overcoming
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Mahars and the Sagoths and any other peoples of Pellucidar who
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: threaten the peace and welfare of his empire."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Slowly they turned the noses of their canoes toward land.  It was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: evident that they were impressed; yet that they were loath to give up
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without further contesting my claim to naval supremacy was also
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apparent, for some of their number seemed to be exhorting the others to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a renewal of the conflict.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: However, at last they drew slowly away, and the Sari, which had not
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: decreased her snail-like speed during this, her first engagement,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: continued upon her slow, uneven way.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Presently Perry stuck his head up through the hatch and hailed me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Have the scoundrels departed?" he asked.  "Have you killed them all?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Those whom I failed to kill have departed, Perry," I replied.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He came out on deck and, peering over the side, descried the lone canoe
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: floating a short distance astern with its grim and grisly freight.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Farther his eyes wandered to the retreating boats.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "David," said he at last, "this is a notable occasion.  It is a great
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: day in the annals of Pellucidar.  We have won a glorious victory.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Your majesty's navy has routed a fleet of the enemy thrice its own
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: size, manned by ten times as many men.  Let us give thanks."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could scarce restrain a smile at Perry's use of the pronoun "we," yet
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was glad to share the rejoicing with him as I shall always be glad to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: share everything with the dear old fellow.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry is the only male coward I have ever known whom I could respect
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and love.  He was not created for fighting; but I think that if the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: occasion should ever arise where it became necessary he would give his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: life cheerfully for me--yes, I KNOW it.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It took us a long time to work around the islands and draw in close to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Anoroc.  In the leisure afforded we took turns working on our map, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by means of the compass and a little guesswork we set down the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shoreline we had left and the three islands with fair accuracy.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Crossed sabers marked the spot where the first great naval engagement
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a world had taken place.  In a note-book we jotted down, as had been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our custom, details that would be of historical value later.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Opposite Anoroc we came to anchor quite close to shore.  I knew from my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: previous experience with the tortuous trails of the island that I could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: never find my way inland to the hidden tree-village of the Mezop
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chieftain, Ja; so we remained aboard the Sari, firing our express
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rifles at intervals to attract the attention of the natives.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After some ten shots had been fired at considerable intervals a body of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: copper-colored warriors appeared upon the shore.  They watched us for a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moment and then I hailed them, asking the whereabouts of my old friend
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ja.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They did not reply at once, but stood with their heads together in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: serious and animated discussion.  Continually they turned their eyes
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward our strange craft.  It was evident that they were greatly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: puzzled by our appearance as well as unable to explain the source of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the loud noises that had attracted their attention to us.  At last one
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the warriors addressed us.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who are you who seek Ja?" he asked.  "What would you of our chief?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We are friends," I replied.  "I am David.  Tell Ja that David, whose
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: life he once saved from a sithic, has come again to visit him.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "If you will send out a canoe we will come ashore.  We cannot bring our
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great warship closer in."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Again they talked for a considerable time.  Then two of them entered a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: canoe that several dragged from its hiding-place in the jungle and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: paddled swiftly toward us.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They were magnificent specimens of manhood.  Perry had never seen a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: member of this red race close to before.  In fact, the dead men in the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: canoe we had left astern after the battle and the survivors who were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: paddling rapidly toward their shore were the first he ever had seen.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He had been greatly impressed by their physical beauty and the promise
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of superior intelligence which their well-shaped skulls gave.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The two who now paddled out received us into their canoe with dignified
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: courtesy.  To my inquiries relative to Ja they explained that he had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not been in the village when our signals were heard, but that runners
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had been sent out after him and that doubtless he was already upon his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: way to the coast.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: One of the men remembered me from the occasion of my former visit to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the island; he was extremely agree-able the moment that he came close
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enough to recognize me. He said that Ja would be delighted to welcome
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me, and that all the tribe of Anoroc knew of me by repute, and had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: received explicit instructions from their chieftain that if any of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them should ever come upon me to show me every kindness and attention.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Upon shore we were received with equal honor.  While we stood
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conversing with our bronze friends a tall warrior leaped suddenly from
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the jungle.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was Ja.  As his eyes fell upon me his face lighted with pleasure.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He came quickly forward to greet me after the manner of his tribe.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Toward Perry he was equally hospitable.  The old man fell in love with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the savage giant as completely as had I. Ja conducted us along the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: maze-like trail to his strange village, where he gave over one of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tree-houses for our exclusive use.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry was much interested in the unique habitation, which resembled
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nothing so much as a huge wasp's nest built around the bole of a tree

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: over me.  I was jerked roughly to my feet and with little consideration

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: over, but without other result than a complete confirmation of my worst
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fears.  Someone had been here ahead of me and stolen the great secret.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The one thing within Pellucidar which might free Dian and me was gone,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nor was it likely that I should ever learn its whereabouts.  If a Mahar
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had found it, which was quite improbable, the chances were that the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dominant race would never divulge the fact that they had recovered the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: precious document.  If a cave man had happened upon it he would have no
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conception of its meaning or value, and as a consequence it would be
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lost or destroyed in short order.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With bowed head and broken hopes I came out of the cave and told the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sagoth chieftain what I had discovered.  It didn't mean much to the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fellow, who doubt-less had but little better idea of the contents of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the document I had been sent to fetch to his masters than would the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cave man who in all probability had discovered it.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Sagoth knew only that I had failed in my mission, so he took
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: advantage of the fact to make the return journey to Phutra as
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disagreeable as possible.  I did not rebel, though I had with me the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: means to destroy them all.  I did not dare rebel because of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: consequences to Dian.  I intended demanding her release on the grounds
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that she was in no way guilty of the theft, and that my failure to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: recover the document had not lessened the value of the good faith I had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had in offering to do so.  The Mahars might keep me in slavery if they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chose, but Dian should be returned safely to her people.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was full of my scheme when we entered Phutra and I was conducted
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: directly to the great audience-chamber.  The Mahars listened to the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: report of the Sagoth chieftain, and so difficult is it to judge their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: emotions from their almost expressionless countenance, that I was at a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loss to know how terrible might be their wrath as they learned that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their great secret, upon which rested the fate of their race, might now
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be irretrievably lost.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Presently I could see that she who presided was communicating something
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the Sagoth interpreter--doubt-less something to be transmitted to me
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which might give me a forewarning of the fate which lay in store for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me. One thing I had decided definitely: If they would not free Dian I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should turn loose upon Phutra with my little arsenal.  Alone I might
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even win to freedom, and if I could learn where Dian was imprisoned it
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would be worth the attempt to free her.  My thoughts were interrupted
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by the interpreter.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The mighty Mahars," he said, "are unable to reconcile your statement
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that the document is lost with your action in sending it to them by a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: special messenger.  They wish to know if you have so soon forgotten the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: truth or if you are merely ignoring it."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I sent them no document," I cried.  "Ask them what they mean."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "They say," he went on after conversing with the Mahar for a moment,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "that just before your return to Phutra, Hooja the Sly One came,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bringing the great secret with him.  He said that you had sent him
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ahead with it, asking him to deliver it and return to Sari where you
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would await him, bringing the girl with him."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Dian?" I gasped.  "The Mahars have given over Dian into the keeping of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hooja."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Surely," he replied.  "What of it? She is only a gilak," as you or I
title: Pellucidar

text: would say, "She is only a cow."
title: Pellucidar

text: CHAPTER VI
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A PENDENT WORLD
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Mahars set me free as they had promised, but with strict
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: injunctions never to approach Phutra or any other Mahar city.  They
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: also made it perfectly plain that they considered me a dangerous
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creature, and that having wiped the slate clean in so far as they were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: under obligations to me, they now considered me fair prey.  Should I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again fall into their hands, they intimated it would go ill with me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They would not tell me in which direction Hooja had set forth with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian, so I departed from Phutra, filled with bitterness against the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Mahars, and rage toward the Sly One who had once again robbed me of my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: greatest treasure.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At first I was minded to go directly back to Anoroc; but upon second
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thought turned my face toward Sari, as I felt that somewhere in that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: direction Hooja would travel, his own country lying in that general
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: direction.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Of my journey to Sari it is only necessary to say that it was fraught
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with the usual excitement and adventure, incident to all travel across
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the face of savage Pellucidar.  The dangers, however, were greatly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reduced through the medium of my armament.  I often wondered how it had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: happened that I had ever survived the first ten years of my life within
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the inner world, when, naked and primitively armed, I had traversed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great areas of her beast-ridden surface.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With the aid of my map, which I had kept with great care during my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: march with the Sagoths in search of the great secret, I arrived at Sari
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at last.  As I topped the lofty plateau in whose rocky cliffs the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: principal tribe of Sarians find their cave-homes, a great hue and cry
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arose from those who first discovered me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Like wasps from their nests the hairy warriors poured from their caves.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The bows with their poison-tipped arrows, which I had taught them to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fashion and to use, were raised against me.  Swords of hammered
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: iron--another of my innovations--menaced me, as with lusty shouts the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: horde charged down.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was a critical moment.  Before I should be recognized I might be
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dead.  It was evident that all semblance of intertribal relationship
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had ceased with my going, and that my people had reverted to their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: former savage, suspicious hatred of all strangers.  My garb must have
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: puzzled them, too, for never before of course had they seen a man
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: clothed in khaki and puttees.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Leaning my express rifle against my body I raised both hands aloft.  It
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was the peace-sign that is recognized everywhere upon the surface of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidar.  The charging warriors paused and surveyed me.  I looked
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for my friend Ghak, the Hairy One, king of Sari, and presently I saw
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him coming from a distance.  Ah, but it was good to see his mighty,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hairy form once more! A friend was Ghak--a friend well worth the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: having; and it had been some time since I had seen a friend.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Shouldering his way through the throng of warriors, the mighty
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chieftain advanced toward me.  There was an expression of puzzlement
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon his fine features.  He crossed the space between the warriors and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: myself, halting before me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I did not speak.  I did not even smile.  I wanted to see if Ghak, my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: principal lieutenant, would recognize me.  For some time he stood there
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looking me over carefully.  His eyes took in my large pith helmet, my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: khaki jacket, and bandoleers of cartridges, the two revolvers swinging
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at my hips, the large rifle resting against my body.  Still I stood
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with my hands above my head.  He examined my puttees and my strong tan
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shoes--a little the worse for wear now.  Then he glanced up once more
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to my face.  As his gaze rested there quite steadily for some moments I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saw recognition tinged with awe creep across his countenance.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Presently without a word he took one of my hands in his and dropping to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one knee raised my fingers to his lips.  Perry had taught them this
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trick, nor ever did the most polished courtier of all the grand courts
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Europe perform the little act of homage with greater grace and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dignity.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Quickly I raised Ghak to his feet, clasping both his hands in mine.  I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: think there must have been tears in my eyes then--I know I felt too
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: full for words.  The king of Sari turned toward his warriors.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Our emperor has come back," he announced.  "Come hither and--"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But he got no further, for the shouts that broke from those savage
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: throats would have drowned the voice of heaven itself.  I had never
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: guessed how much they thought of me.  As they clustered around, almost
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fighting for the chance to kiss my hand, I saw again the vision of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: empire which I had thought faded forever.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With such as these I could conquer a world.  With such as these I WOULD
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conquer one! If the Sarians had remained loyal, so too would the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Amozites be loyal still, and the Kalians, and the Suvians, and all the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great tribes who had formed the federation that was to emancipate the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: human race of Pellucidar.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry was safe with the Mezops; I was safe with the Sarians; now if
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian were but safe with me the future would look bright indeed.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It did not take long to outline to Ghak all that had befallen me since
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had departed from Pellucidar, and to get down to the business of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: finding Dian, which to me at that moment was of even greater importance
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than the very empire itself.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I told him that Hooja had stolen her, he stamped his foot in rage.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is always the Sly One!" he cried.  "It was Hooja who caused the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first trouble between you and the Beautiful One.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It was Hooja who betrayed our trust, and all but caused our recapture
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by the Sagoths that time we escaped from Phutra.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It was Hooja who tricked you and substituted a Mahar for Dian when you
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: started upon your return journey to your own world.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It was Hooja who schemed and lied until he had turned the kingdoms one
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: against another and destroyed the federation.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "When we had him in our power we were foolish to let him live.  Next
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time--"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ghak did not need to finish his sentence.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He has become a very powerful enemy now," I replied.  "That he is
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: allied in some way with the Mahars is evidenced by the familiarity of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his relations with the Sagoths who were accompanying me in search of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the great secret, for it must have been Hooja whom I saw conversing
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with them just before we reached the valley.  Doubtless they told him
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of our quest and he hastened on ahead of us, discovered the cave and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stole the document.  Well does he deserve his appellation of the Sly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: One."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With Ghak and his head men I held a number of consultations.  The
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upshot of them was a decision to combine our search for Dian with an
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attempt to rebuild the crumbled federation.  To this end twenty
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warriors were despatched in pairs to ten of the leading kingdoms, with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instructions to make every effort to discover the whereabouts of Hooja
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and Dian, while prosecuting their missions to the chieftains to whom
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they were sent.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ghak was to remain at home to receive the various delegations which we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: invited to come to Sari on the business of the federation.  Four
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hundred warriors were started for Anoroc to fetch Perry and the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: contents of the prospector, to the capitol of the empire, which was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: also the principal settlements of the Sarians.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At first it was intended that I remain at Sari, that I might be in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: readiness to hasten forth at the first report of the discovery of Dian;
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but I found the inaction in the face of my deep solicitude for the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: welfare of my mate so galling that scarce had the several units
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: departed upon their missions before I, too, chafed to be actively
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: engaged upon the search.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was after my second sleep, subsequent to the departure of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warriors, as I recall, that I at last went to Ghak with the admission
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I could no longer support the intolerable longing to be personally
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the trail of my lost love.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ghak tried to dissuade me, though I could tell that his heart was with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me in my wish to be away and really doing something.  It was while we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were arguing upon the subject that a stranger, with hands above his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: head, entered the village.  He was immediately surrounded by warriors
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and conducted to Ghak's presence.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The fellow was a typical cave man-squat muscular, and hairy, and of a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: type I had not seen before.  His features, like those of all the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: primeval men of Pellucidar, were regular and fine.  His weapons
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: consisted of a stone ax and knife and a heavy knobbed bludgeon of wood.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: His skin was very white.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who are you?" asked Ghak.  "And whence come you?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am Kolk, son of Goork, who is chief of the Thurians," replied the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stranger.  "From Thuria I have come in search of the land of Amoz,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: where dwells Dacor, the Strong One, who stole my sister, Canda, the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Grace-ful One, to be his mate.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We of Thuria had heard of a great chieftain who has bound together
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: many tribes, and my father has sent me to Dacor to learn if there be
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: truth in these stories, and if so to offer the services of Thuria to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him whom we have heard called emperor."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The stories are true," replied Ghak, "and here is the emperor of whom
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you have heard.  You need travel no farther."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kolk was delighted.  He told us much of the wonderful resources of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thuria, the Land of Awful Shadow, and of his long journey in search of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Amoz.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And why," I asked, "does Goork, your father, desire to join his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kingdom to the empire?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "There are two reasons," replied the young man.  "Forever have the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Mahars, who dwell beyond the Lidi Plains which lie at the farther rim
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the Land of Awful Shadow, taken heavy toll of our people, whom they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: either force into lifelong slavery or fatten for their feasts.  We have
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heard that the great emperor makes successful war upon the Mahars,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: against whom we should be glad to fight.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Recently has another reason come.  Upon a great island which lies in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Sojar Az, but a short distance from our shores, a wicked man has
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: collected a great band of outcast warriors of all tribes.  Even are
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there many Sagoths among them, sent by the Mahars to aid the Wicked One.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "This band makes raids upon our villages, and it is constantly growing

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in size and strength, for the Mahars give liberty to any of their male
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prisoners who will promise to fight with this band against the enemies

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the Mahars.  It is the purpose of the Mahars thus to raise a force

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of our own kind to combat the growth and menace of the new empire of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which I have come to seek information.  All this we learned from one of

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then escaped at the first opportunity."
title: Pellucidar

text: I have never been much of a runner; I hate running.  But if ever a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sprinter broke into smithereens all world's records it was I that day
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliff between two narrow fiords toward the Sojar Az.  Just as I reached
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leaped and closed his massive jaws upon my shoulder.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice
