title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: across the nose.  He looked it me for a moment in surprised
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bewilderment, and then he growled again.  I made another feint at him,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: expecting that it would bring him at my throat; but instead he winced
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and crouched down.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Raja was subdued!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I stooped and patted him.  Then I took a piece of the rope that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: constituted a part of my equipment and made a leash for him.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thus we resumed our journey toward Thuria.  The youth who had seen us
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was evidently of the Thurians.  That he had lost no time in racing
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: homeward and spreading the word of my coming was evidenced when we had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: come within sight of the clearing, and the village--the first real
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: village, by the way, that I had ever seen constructed by human
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidarians.  There was a rude rectangle walled with logs and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boulders, in which were a hundred or more thatched huts of similar
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: construction.  There was no gate.  Ladders that could be removed by
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: night led over the palisade.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Before the village were assembled a great concourse of warriors.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Inside I could see the heads of women and children peering over the top
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the wall; and also, farther back, the long necks of lidi, topped by
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their tiny heads.  Lidi, by the way, is both the singular and plural
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: form of the noun that describes the huge beasts of burden of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thurians.  They are enormous quadrupeds, eighty or a hundred feet long,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with very small heads perched at the top of very long, slender necks.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Their heads are quite forty feet from the ground.  Their gait is slow
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and deliberate, but so enormous are their strides that, as a matter of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fact, they cover the ground quite rapidly.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry has told me that they are almost identical with the fossilized
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remains of the diplodocus of the outer crust's Jurassic age.  I have to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: take his word for it--and I guess you will, unless you know more of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: such matters than I.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we came in sight of the warriors the men set up a great jabbering.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Their eyes were wide in astonishment--not only, I presume, because of my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange garmenture, but as well from the fact that I came in company
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a jalok, which is the Pellucidarian name of the hyaenodon.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Raja tugged at his leash, growling and showing his long white fangs.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He would have liked nothing better than to be at the throats of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whole aggregation; but I held him in with the leash, though it took all
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my strength to do it.  My free hand I held above my head, palm out, in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: token of the peacefulness of my mission.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In the foreground I saw the youth who had discovered us, and I could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tell from the way he carried himself that he was quite overcome by his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: own importance.  The warriors about him were all fine looking fellows,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though shorter and squatter than the Sarians or the Amozites.  Their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: color, too, was a bit lighter, owing, no doubt, to the fact that much
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of their lives is spent within the shadow of the world that hangs
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forever above their country.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A little in advance of the others was a bearded fellow tricked out in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: many ornaments.  I didn't need to ask to know that he was the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chieftain--doubtless Goork, father of Kolk.  Now to him I addressed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: myself.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am David," I said, "Emperor of the Federated Kingdoms of Pellucidar.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Doubtless you have heard of me?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He nodded his head affirmatively.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I come from Sari," I continued, "where I just met Kolk, the son of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Goork.  I bear a token from Kolk to his father, which will prove that I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: am a friend."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Again the warrior nodded.  "I am Goork," he said.  "Where is the token?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Here," I replied, and fished into the game-bag where I had placed it.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Goork and his people waited in silence.  My hand searched the inside of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the bag.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was empty!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The token had been stolen with my arms!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: CHAPTER VIII
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: CAPTIVE
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When Goork and his people saw that I had no token they commenced to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: taunt me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You do not come from Kolk, but from the Sly One!" they cried.  "He has
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sent you from the island to spy upon us. Go away, or we will set upon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you and kill you."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I explained that all my belongings had been stolen from me, and that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the robber must have taken the token too; but they didn't believe me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As proof that I was one of Hooja's people, they pointed to my weapons,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which they said were ornamented like those of the island clan.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Further, they said that no good man went in company with a jalok--and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that by this line of reasoning I certainly was a bad man.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I saw that they were not naturally a war-like tribe, for they preferred
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I leave in peace rather than force them to attack me, whereas the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sarians would have killed a suspicious stranger first and inquired into
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his purposes later.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I think Raja sensed their antagonism, for he kept tugging at his leash
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and growling ominously.  They were a bit in awe of him, and kept at a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: safe distance.  It was evident that they could not comprehend why it
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was that this savage brute did not turn upon me and rend me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I wasted a long time there trying to persuade Goork to accept me at my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: own valuation, but he was too canny.  The best he would do was to give
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us food, which he did, and direct me as to the safest portion of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: island upon which to attempt a landing, though even as he told me I am
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sure that he thought my request for information but a blind to deceive
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him as to my true knowledge of the insular stronghold.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last I turned away from them--rather disheartened, for I had hoped
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to be able to enlist a considerable force of them in an attempt to rush
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hooja's horde and rescue Dian.  Back along the beach toward the hidden
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: canoe we made our way.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: By the time we came to the cairn I was dog-tired.  Throwing myself upon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sand I soon slept, and with Raja stretched out beside me I felt a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: far greater security than I had enjoyed for a long time.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I awoke much refreshed to find Raja's eyes glued upon me.  The moment I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: opened mine he rose, stretched himself, and without a backward glance
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plunged into the jungle.  For several minutes I could hear him crashing
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through the brush.  Then all was silent.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I wondered if he had left me to return to his fierce pack.  A feeling
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of loneliness overwhelmed me.  With a sigh I turned to the work of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dragging the canoe down to the sea.  As I entered the jungle where the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dugout lay a hare darted from beneath the boat's side, and a well-aimed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cast of my javelin brought it down.  I was hungry--I had not realized
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it before--so I sat upon the edge of the canoe and devoured my repast.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The last remnants gone, I again busied myself with preparations for my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: expedition to the island.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I did not know for certain that Dian was there; but I surmised as much.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nor could I guess what obstacles might confront me in an effort to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rescue her.  For a time I loitered about after I had the canoe at the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: water's edge, hoping against hope that Raja would return; but he did
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not, so I shoved the awkward craft through the surf and leaped into it.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was still a little downcast by the desertion of my new-found friend,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though I tried to assure myself that it was nothing but what I might
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have expected.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The savage brute had served me well in the short time that we had been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: together, and had repaid his debt of gratitude to me, since he had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saved my life, or at least my liberty, no less certainly than I had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saved his life when he was injured and drowning.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The trip across the water to the island was uneventful.  I was mighty
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: glad to be in the sunshine again when I passed out of the shadow of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dead world about half-way between the mainland and the island.  The hot
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rays of the noonday sun did a great deal toward raising my spirits, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dispelling the mental gloom in which I had been shrouded almost
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: continually since entering the Land of Awful Shadow.  There is nothing
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more dispiriting to me than absence of sunshine.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had paddled to the southwestern point, which Goork said he believed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to be the least frequented portion of the island, as he had never seen
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boats put off from there.  I found a shallow reef running far out into
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sea and rather precipitous cliffs running almost to the surf.  It
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was a nasty place to land, and I realized now why it was not used by
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the natives; but at last I managed, after a good wetting, to beach my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: canoe and scale the cliffs.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The country beyond them appeared more open and park-like than I had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: anticipated, since from the mainland the entire coast that is visible
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seems densely clothed with tropical jungle.  This jungle, as I could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see from the vantage-point of the cliff-top, formed but a relatively
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: narrow strip between the sea and the more open forest and meadow of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: interior.  Farther back there was a range of low but apparently very
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rocky hills, and here and there all about were visible flat-topped
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: masses of rock--small mountains, in fact--which reminded me of pictures
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had seen of landscapes in New Mexico.  Altogether, the country was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: very much broken and very beautiful.  From where I stood I counted no
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: less than a dozen streams winding down from among the table-buttes and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: emptying into a pretty river which flowed away in a northeasterly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: direction toward the op-posite end of the island.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I let my eyes roam over the scene I suddenly became aware of figures
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moving upon the flat top of a far-distant butte.  Whether they were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beast or human, though, I could not make out; but at least they were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alive, so I determined to prosecute my search for Hooja's stronghold in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the general direction of this butte.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To descend to the valley required no great effort.  As I swung along
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through the lush grass and the fragrant flowers, my cudgel swinging in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my hand and my javelin looped across my shoulders with its aurochs-hide
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strap, I felt equal to any emergency, ready for any danger.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had covered quite a little distance, and I was passing through a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strip of wood which lay at the foot of one of the flat-topped hills,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when I became conscious of the sensation of being watched.  My life
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: within Pellucidar has rather quickened my senses of sight, hearing, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: smell, and, too, certain primitive intuitive or instinctive qualities
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that seem blunted in civilized man.  But, though I was positive that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eyes were upon me, I could see no sign of any living thing within the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wood other than the many, gay-plumaged birds and little monkeys which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: filled the trees with life, color, and action.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To you it may seem that my conviction was the result of an overwrought
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imagination, or to the actual reality of the prying eyes of the little
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: monkeys or the curious ones of the birds; but there is a difference
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which I cannot explain between the sensation of casual observation and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: studied espionage.  A sheep might gaze at you without transmitting a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warning through your subjective mind, because you are in no danger from
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a sheep.  But let a tiger gaze fixedly at you from ambush, and unless
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: your primitive instincts are completely calloused you will presently
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: commence to glance furtively about and be filled with vague,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unreasoning terror.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thus was it with me then.  I grasped my cudgel more firmly and unslung
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my javelin, carrying it in my left hand.  I peered to left and right,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but I saw nothing.  Then, all quite suddenly, there fell about my neck
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and shoulders, around my arms and body, a number of pliant fiber ropes.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In a jiffy I was trussed up as neatly as you might wish.  One of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nooses dropped to my ankles and was jerked up with a suddenness that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brought me to my face upon the ground.  Then something heavy and hairy
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sprang upon my back.  I fought to draw my knife, but hairy hands
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: grasped my wrists and, dragging them behind my back, bound them
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: securely.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Next my feet were bound.  Then I was turned over upon my back to look
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: up into the faces of my captors.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And what faces! Imagine if you can a cross between a sheep and a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gorilla, and you will have some conception of the physiognomy of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creature that bent close above me, and of those of the half-dozen
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: others that clustered about.  There was the facial length and great
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eyes of the sheep, and the bull-neck and hideous fangs of the gorilla.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The bodies and limbs were both man and gorilla-like.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As they bent over me they conversed in a mono-syllabic tongue that was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perfectly intelligible to me.  It was something of a simplified
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: language that had no need for aught but nouns and verbs, but such words
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as it included were the same as those of the human beings of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidar.  It was amplified by many gestures which filled in the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: speech-gaps.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I asked them what they intended doing with me; but, like our own North
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: American Indians when questioned by a white man, they pretended not to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: understand me.  One of them swung me to his shoulder as lightly as if I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had been a shoat.  He was a huge creature, as were his fellows,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: standing fully seven feet upon his short legs and weighing considerably
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more than a quarter of a ton.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Two went ahead of my bearer and three behind.  In this order we cut to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the right through the forest to the foot of the hill where precipitous
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliffs appeared to bar our farther progress in this direction.  But my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escort never paused.  Like ants upon a wall, they scaled that seemingly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unscalable barrier, clinging, Heaven knows how, to its ragged
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perpendicular face.  During most of the short journey to the summit I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: must admit that my hair stood on end.  Presently, however, we topped
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the thing and stood upon the level mesa which crowned it.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Immediately from all about, out of burrows and rough, rocky lairs,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: poured a perfect torrent of beasts similar to my captors.  They
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: clustered about, jabbering at my guards and attempting to get their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hands upon me, whether from curiosity or a desire to do me bodily harm
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I did not know, since my escort with bared fangs and heavy blows kept
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them off.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Across the mesa we went, to stop at last before a large pile of rocks
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in which an opening appeared.  Here my guards set me upon my feet and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: called out a word which sounded like "Gr-gr-gr!" and which I later
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: learned was the name of their king.

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

text: When all had been related Gr-gr-gr questioned me.  I shall not attempt
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You are an enemy," was Gr-gr-gr's initial declaration.  "You belong to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the tribe of Hooja."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ah!  So they knew Hooja and he was their enemy!  Good!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am an enemy of Hooja," I replied.  "He has stolen my mate and I have
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: come here to take her away from him and punish Hooja."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "How could you do that alone?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I do not know," I answered, "but I should have tried had you not
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: captured me.  What do you intend to do with me?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You will not kill me?" I asked.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We do not kill except in self-defense," he replied; "self-defense and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: punishment.  Those who would kill us and those who do wrong we kill.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: If we knew you were one of Hooja's people we might kill you, for all
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hooja's people are bad people; but you say you are an enemy of Hooja.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: You may not speak the truth, but until we learn that you have lied we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shall not kill you.  You shall work."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "If you hate Hooja," I suggested, "why not let me, who hate him, too,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: go and punish him?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For some time Gr-gr-gr sat in thought.  Then he raised his head and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: addressed my guard.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Take him to his work," he ordered.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: His tone was final.  As if to emphasize it he turned and entered his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: burrow.  My guard conducted me farther into the mesa, where we came
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warm spring.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The view that opened before me was the most surprising that I have ever
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seen.  In the hollow, which must have covered several hundred acres,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were numerous fields of growing things, and working all about with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had seen within Pellucidar.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They put me to work cultivating in a patch of melons.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I never was a farmer nor particularly keen for this sort of work, and I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: am free to confess that time never had dragged so heavily as it did
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: during the hour or the year I spent there at that work.  How long it
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: really was I do not know, of course; but it was all too long.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The creatures that worked about me were quite simple and friendly.  One
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of them proved to be a son of Gr-gr-gr.  He had broken some minor
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tribal law, and was working out his sentence in the fields.  He told me
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that his tribe had lived upon this hilltop always, and that there were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: other tribes like them dwelling upon other hilltops.  They had no wars
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and had always lived in peace and harmony, menaced only by the larger
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carnivora of the island, until my kind had come under a creature called
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Now they were afraid; but some day they would go in a body and fall
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon Hooja and his people and slay them all.  I explained to him that I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was Hooja's enemy, and asked, when they were ready to go, that I be
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Gr-gr-gr's son seemed much impressed by my suggestion.  He said that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the matter.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Some time after this Gr-gr-gr came through the fields where we were,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to him, and that I was one of Hooja's people.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Wherefore," he concluded, "we shall slay you as soon as the melons are
title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And hasten I did.  I hastened to cultivate the weeds which grew among
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the melon-vines.  Where there had been one sickly weed before, I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it up and transplanted it among my charges.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My masters did not seem to realize my perfidy.  They saw me always
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: laboring diligently in the melon-patch, and as time enters not into the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reckoning of Pellucidarians--even of human beings and much less of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brutes and half brutes--I might have lived on indefinitely through this
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had built a little shelter of rocks and brush where I might crawl in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and sleep out of the perpetual light and heat of the noonday sun.  When
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My masters never interposed the slightest objection.  As a matter of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when left to themselves.  Their awe-inspiring size, terrific strength,
title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returned to the village unscratched, while but a single one of Hooja's
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leader.  Now Hooja was coming to punish Gr-gr-gr's people.  With his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: large force, armed with the bows and arrows that Hooja had learned from
title: Pellucidar

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Along the very edge of the cliff-top stood a thin line of mighty
title: Pellucidar

text: males--the best rope-throwers of the tribe.  A few feet behind these

text: But it was the work of the first two lines that interested me.  The
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forces of Hooja--a great horde of savage Sagoths and primeval cave
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: men--were working their way up the steep cliff-face, their agility but
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aloft--even he who was burdened by my weight.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar

text: upon the cliff-top.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Hurl these down upon the enemy!" I cried to him.  "Tell your warriors
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to throw rocks down upon them!"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At my words the others of the first line, who had been interested
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spectators of my tactics, seized upon great boulders or bits of rock,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whichever came first to their hands, and, without waiting for a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: command from Gr-gr-gr, deluged the terrified cave men with a perfect
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: avalanche of stone.  In less than no time the cliff-face was stripped
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of enemies and the village of Gr-gr-gr was saved.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Gr-gr-gr was standing beside me when the last of the cave men
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disappeared in rapid flight down the valley.  He was looking at me
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intently.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Those were your people," he said.  "Why did you kill them?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "They were not my people," I returned.  "I have told you that before,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but you would not believe me.  Will you believe me now when I tell you
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I hate Hooja and his tribe as much as you do? Will you believe me
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when I tell you that I wish to be the friend of Gr-gr-gr?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For some time he stood there beside me, scratching his head.  Evidently
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it was no less difficult for him to readjust his preconceived
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conclusions than it is for most human beings; but finally the idea
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: percolated--which it might never have done had he been a man, or I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might qualify that statement by saying had he been some men.  Finally
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he spoke.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Gilak," he said, "you have made Gr-gr-gr ashamed.  He would have
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: killed you.  How can he reward you?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Set me free," I replied quickly.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You are free," he said.  "You may go down when you wish, or you may
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stay with us.  If you go you may always return.  We are your friends."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Naturally, I elected to go.  I explained all over again to Gr-gr-gr the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nature of my mission.  He listened attentively; after I had done he
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: offered to send some of his people with me to guide me to Hooja's
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: village.  I was not slow in accepting his offer.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: First, however, we must eat.  The hunters upon whom Hooja's men had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fallen had brought back the meat of a great thag.  There would be a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feast to commemorate the victory--a feast and dancing.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had never witnessed a tribal function of the brute-folk, though I had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: often heard strange sounds coming from the village, where I had not
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been allowed since my capture.  Now I took part in one of their orgies.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It will live forever in my memory.  The combination of bestiality and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: humanity was oftentimes pathetic, and again grotesque or horrible.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Beneath the glaring noonday sun, in the sweltering heat of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mesa-top, the huge, hairy creatures leaped in a great circle.  They
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: coiled and threw their fiber-ropes; they hurled taunts and insults at
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: an imaginary foe; they fell upon the carcass of the thag and literally
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tore it to pieces; and they ceased only when, gorged, they could no
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: longer move.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had to wait until the processes of digestion had released my escort
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from its torpor.  Some had eaten until their abdomens were so distended
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I thought they must burst, for beside the thag there had been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fully a hundred antelopes of various sizes and varied degrees of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: decomposition, which they had unearthed from burial beneath the floors
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of their lairs to grace the banquet-board.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But at last we were started--six great males and myself.  Gr-gr-gr had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returned my weapons to me, and at last I was once more upon my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: oft-interrupted way toward my goal.  Whether I should find Dian at the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: end of my journey or no I could not even surmise; but I was none the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: less impatient to be off, for if only the worst lay in store for me I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wished to know even the worst at once.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could scarce believe that my proud mate would still be alive in the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: power of Hooja; but time upon Pellucidar is so strange a thing that I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: realized that to her or to him only a few minutes might have elapsed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: since his subtle trickery had enabled him to steal her away from
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Phutra.  Or she might have found the means either to repel his advances
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: or escape him.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we descended the cliff we disturbed a great pack of large hyena-like
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beasts--hyaena spelaeus, Perry calls them--who were busy among the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: corpses of the cave men fallen in battle.  The ugly creatures were far
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from the cowardly things that our own hyenas are reputed to be; they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stood their ground with bared fangs as we approached them.  But, as I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was later to learn, so formidable are the brute-folk that there are few
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even of the larger carnivora that will not make way for them when they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: go abroad.  So the hyenas moved a little from our line of march,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: closing in again upon their feasts when we had passed.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We made our way steadily down the rim of the beautiful river which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flows the length of the island, coming at last to a wood rather denser
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than any that I had before encountered in this country.  Well within
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this forest my escort halted.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "There!" they said, and pointed ahead.  "We are to go no farther."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thus having guided me to my destination they left me. Ahead of me,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through the trees, I could see what appeared to be the foot of a steep
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hill.  Toward this I made my way.  The forest ran to the very base of a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliff, in the face of which were the mouths of many caves.  They
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appeared untenanted; but I decided to watch for a while before
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: venturing farther.  A large tree, densely foliaged, offered a splendid
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vantage-point from which to spy upon the cliff, so I clambered among
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: its branches where, securely hidden, I could watch what transpired
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about the caves.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It seemed that I had scarcely settled myself in a comfortable position
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before a party of cave men emerged from one of the smaller apertures in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliff-face, about fifty feet from the base.  They descended into
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the forest and disappeared.  Soon after came several others from the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: same cave, and after them, at a short interval, a score of women and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: children, who came into the wood to gather fruit.  There were several
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warriors with them--a guard, I presume.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After this came other parties, and two or three groups who passed out
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the forest and up the cliff-face to enter the same cave.  I could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not understand it.  All who came out had emerged from the same cave.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: All who returned reentered it.  No other cave gave evidence of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: habitation, and no cave but one of extraordinary size could have
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accommodated all the people whom I had seen pass in and out of its
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mouth.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For a long time I sat and watched the coming and going of great numbers
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the cave-folk.  Not once did one leave the cliff by any other
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: opening save that from which I had seen the first party come, nor did
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: any reenter the cliff through another aperture.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: What a cave it must be, I thought, that houses an entire tribe!  But
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dissatisfied of the truth of my surmise, I climbed higher among the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: branches of the tree that I might get a better view of other portions
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the cliff.  High above the ground I reached a point whence I could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see the summit of the hill.  Evidently it was a flat-topped butte
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: similar to that on which dwelt the tribe of Gr-gr-gr.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I sat gazing at it a figure appeared at the very edge.  It was that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a young girl in whose hair was a gorgeous bloom plucked from some
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flowering tree of the forest.  I had seen her pass beneath me but a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: short while before and enter the small cave that had swallowed all of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the returning tribesmen.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The mystery was solved.  The cave was but the mouth of a passage that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: led upward through the cliff to the summit of the hill.  It served
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: merely as an avenue from their lofty citadel to the valley below.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: No sooner had the truth flashed upon me than the realization came that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I must seek some other means of reaching the village, for to pass
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unobserved through this well-traveled thoroughfare would be impossible.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At the moment there was no one in sight below me, so I slid quickly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from my arboreal watch-tower to the ground and moved rapidly away to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the right with the intention of circling the hill if necessary until I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had found an unwatched spot where I might have some slight chance of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scaling the heights and reaching the top unseen.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I kept close to the edge of the forest, in the very midst of which the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hill seemed to rise.  Though I carefully scanned the cliff as I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: traversed its base, I saw no sign of any other entrance than that to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which my guides had led me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After some little time the roar of the sea broke upon my ears.  Shortly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: after I came upon the broad ocean which breaks at this point at the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: very foot of the great hill where Hooja had found safe refuge for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: himself and his villains.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was just about to clamber along the jagged rocks which lie at the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: base of the cliff next to the sea, in search of some foothold to the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: top, when I chanced to see a canoe rounding the end of the island.  I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: threw myself down behind a large boulder where I could watch the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dugout and its occupants without myself being seen.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They paddled toward me for a while and then, about a hundred yards from
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me, they turned straight in toward the foot of the frowning cliffs.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: From where I was it seemed that they were bent upon self-destruction,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: since the roar of the breakers beating upon the perpendicular rock-face
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appeared to offer only death to any one who might venture within their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: relentless clutch.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A mass of rock would soon hide them from my view; but so keen was the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: excitement of the instant that I could not refrain from crawling
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forward to a point whence I could watch the dashing of the small craft
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to pieces on the jagged rocks that loomed before her, although I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: risked discovery from above to accomplish my design.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I had reached a point where I could again see the dugout, I was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: just in time to see it glide unharmed between two needle-pointed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sentinels of granite and float quietly upon the unruffled bosom of a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tiny cove.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Again I crouched behind a boulder to observe what would next transpire;
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nor did I have long to wait.  The dugout, which contained but two men,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was drawn close to the rocky wall.  A fiber rope, one end of which was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tied to the boat, was made fast about a projection of the cliff face.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then the two men commenced the ascent of the almost perpendicular wall
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward the summit several hundred feet above.  I looked on in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: amazement, for, splendid climbers though the cave men of Pellucidar
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are, I never before had seen so remarkable a feat performed.  Upwardly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they moved without a pause, to disappear at last over the summit.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I felt reasonably sure that they had gone for a while at least I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crawled from my hiding-place and at the risk of a broken neck leaped
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and scrambled to the spot where their canoe was moored.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: If they had scaled that cliff I could, and if I couldn't I should die
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the attempt.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But when I turned to the accomplishment of the task I found it easier
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than I had imagined it would be, since I immediately discovered that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shallow hand and foot-holds had been scooped in the cliff's rocky face,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forming a crude ladder from the base to the summit.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last I reached the top, and very glad I was, too.  Cautiously I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raised my head until my eyes were above the cliff-crest.  Before me
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spread a rough mesa, liberally sprinkled with large boulders.  There
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was no village in sight nor any living creature.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I drew myself to level ground and stood erect.  A few trees grew among
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the boulders.  Very carefully I advanced from tree to tree and boulder
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to boulder toward the inland end of the mesa.  I stopped often to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: listen and look cautiously about me in every direction.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: How I wished that I had my revolvers and rifle! I would not have to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: worm my way like a scared cat toward Hooja's village, nor did I relish
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doing so now; but Dian's life might hinge upon the success of my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: venture, and so I could not afford to take chances.  To have met
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suddenly with discovery and had a score or more of armed warriors upon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me might have been very grand and heroic; but it would have immediately
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: put an end to all my earthly activities, nor have accomplished aught in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the service of Dian.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Well, I must have traveled nearly a mile across that mesa without
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seeing a sign of anyone, when all of a sudden, as I crept around the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: edge of a boulder, I ran plump into a man, down on all fours like
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: myself, crawling toward me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: CHAPTER X
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: THE RAID ON THE CAVE-PRISON
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: His head was turned over his shoulder as I first saw him--he was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looking back toward the village.  As I leaped for him his eyes fell
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon me.  Never in my life have I seen a more surprised mortal than
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this poor cave man.  Before he could utter a single scream of warning
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: or alarm I had my fingers on his throat and had dragged him behind the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boulder, where I proceeded to sit upon him, while I figured out what I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had best do with him.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He struggled a little at first, but finally lay still, and so I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: released the pressure of my fingers at his  windpipe, for which I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imagine he was quite thankful--I know that I should have been.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I hated to kill him in cold blood; but what else I was to do with him I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could not see, for to turn him loose would have been merely to have the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entire village aroused and down upon me in a moment.  The fellow lay
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looking up at me with the surprise still deeply written on his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: countenance.  At last, all of a sudden, a look of recognition entered
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his eyes.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I have seen you before," he said.  "I saw you in the arena at the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Mahars' city of Phutra when the thipdars dragged the tarag from you and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: your mate.  I never understood that.  Afterward they put me in the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arena with two warriors from Gombul."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He smiled in recollection.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It would have been the same had there been ten warriors from Gombul.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I slew them, winning my freedom.  Look!"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He half turned his left shoulder toward me, exhibiting the newly healed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scar of the Mahars' branded mark.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Then," he continued, "as I was returning to my people I met some of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them fleeing.  They told me that one called Hooja the Sly One had come
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and seized our village, putting our people into slavery.  So I hurried
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hither to learn the truth, and, sure enough, here I found Hooja and his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wicked men living in my village, and my father's people but slaves

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chief's son, and through me he hoped to win my father's warriors back
title: Pellucidar
