title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: commence.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Among his prisoners is Dian the Beautiful One, whose brother, Dacor
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Strong One, chief of Amoz, once saved my life when he came to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thuria to steal a mate.  I helped him capture her, and we are good
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: friends.  So when I learned that Dian the Beautiful One was Hooja's
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prisoner, I told him that I would not aid him if he harmed her.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Recently one of Hooja's warriors overheard me talking with another
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prisoner.  We were planning to combine all the prisoners, seize
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weapons, and when most of Hooja's warriors were away, slay the rest and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: retake our hilltop.  Had we done so we could have held it, for there
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are only two entrances--the narrow tunnel at one end and the steep path
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: up the cliffs at the other.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But when Hooja heard what we had planned he was very angry, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ordered that I die.  They bound me hand and foot and placed me in a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cave until all the warriors should return to witness my death; but
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: while they were away I heard someone calling me in a muffled voice
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which seemed to come from the wall of the cave.  When I replied the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: voice, which was a woman's, told me that she had overheard all that had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passed between me and those who had brought me thither, and that she
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was Dacor's sister and would find a way to help me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Presently a little hole appeared in the wall at the point from which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the voice had come.  After a time I saw a woman's hand digging with a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bit of stone.  Dacor's sister made a hole in the wall between the cave
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: where I lay bound and that in which she had been confined, and soon she
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was by my side and had cut my bonds.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We talked then, and I offered to make the attempt to take her away and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back to the land of Sari, where she told me she would be able to learn
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the whereabouts of her mate.  Just now I was going to the other end of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the island to see if a boat lay there, and if the way was clear for our
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escape.  Most of the boats are always away now, for a great many of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hooja's men and nearly all the slaves are upon the Island of Trees,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: where Hooja is having many boats built to carry his warriors across the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: water to the mouth of a great river which he discovered while he was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returning from Phutra--a vast river that empties into the sea there."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The speaker pointed toward the northeast.  "It is wide  and  smooth and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slow-running  almost  to  the land of Sari," he added.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And where is Dian the Beautiful One now?" I asked.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had released my prisoner as soon as I found that he was Hooja's
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enemy, and now the pair of us were squat-ting beside the boulder while
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he told his story.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "She returned to the cave where she had been imprisoned," he replied,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "and is awaiting me there."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "There is no danger that Hooja will come while you are away?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Hooja is upon the Island of Trees," he replied.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Can you direct me to the cave so that I can find it alone?" I asked.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He said he could, and in the strange yet explicit fashion of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidarians he explained minutely how I might reach the cave where
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he had been imprisoned, and through the hole in its wall reach Dian.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I thought it best for but one of us to return, since two could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accomplish but little more than one and would double the risk of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovery.  In the meantime he could make his way to the sea and guard
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the boat, which I told him lay there at the foot of the cliff.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I told him to await us at the cliff-top, and if Dian came alone to do
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his best to get away with her and take her to Sari, as I thought it
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quite possible that, in case of detection and pursuit, it might be
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: necessary for me to hold off Hooja's people while Dian made her way
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alone to where my new friend was to await her.  I impressed upon him
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the fact that he might have to resort to trickery or even to force to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: get Dian to leave me; but I made him promise that he would sacrifice
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: everything, even his life, in an attempt to rescue Dacor's sister.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then we parted--he to take up his position where he could watch the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boat and await Dian, I to crawl cautiously on toward the caves.  I had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: no difficulty in following the directions given me by Juag, the name by
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which Dacor's friend said he was called.  There was the leaning tree,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my first point he told me to look for after rounding the boulder where
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we had met.  After that I crawled to the balanced rock, a huge boulder
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: resting upon a tiny base no larger than the palm of your hand.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: From here I had my first view of the village of caves.  A low bluff ran
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: diagonally across one end of the mesa, and in the face of this bluff
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were the mouths of many caves.  Zig-zag trails led up to them, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: narrow ledges scooped from the face of the soft rock connected those
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the same level.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The cave in which Juag had been confined was at the extreme end of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliff nearest me.  By taking advantage of the bluff itself, I could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approach within a few feet of the aperture without being visible from
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: any other cave.  There were few people about at the time; most of these
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were congregated at the foot of the far end of the bluff, where they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were so engrossed in excited conversation that I felt but little fear
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of detection.  However I exercised the greatest care in approaching the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliff.  After watching for a while until I caught an instant when every
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: head was turned away from me, I darted, rabbitlike, into the cave.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Like many of the man-made caves of Pellucidar, this one consisted of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: three chambers, one behind another, and all unlit except for what
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sunlight filtered in through the external opening.  The result was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gradually increasing darkness as one passed into each succeeding
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chamber.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In the last of the three I could just distinguish objects, and that was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all.  As I was groping around the walls for the hole that should lead
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into the cave where Dian was imprisoned, I heard a man's voice quite
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: close to me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The speaker had evidently but just entered, for he spoke in a loud
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tone, demanding the whereabouts of one whom he had come in search of.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Where are you, woman?" he cried.  "Hooja has sent for you."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And then a woman's voice answered him:
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And what does Hooja want of me?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The voice was Dian's.  I groped in the direction of the sounds, feeling
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the hole.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He wishes you brought to the Island of Trees," replied the man; "for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he is ready to take you as his mate."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I will not go," said Dian.  "I will die first."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am sent to bring you, and bring you I shall."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could hear him crossing the cave toward her.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Frantically I clawed the wall of the cave in which I was in an effort
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to find the elusive aperture that would lead me to Dian's side.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I heard the sound of a scuffle in the next cave.  Then my fingers sank
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into loose rock and earth in the side of the cave.  In an instant I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: realized why I had been unable to find the opening while I had been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lightly feeling the surface of the walls--Dian had blocked up the hole
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she had made lest it arouse suspicion and lead to an early discovery of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Juag's escape.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Plunging my weight against the crumbling mass, I sent it crashing into
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the adjoining cavern.  With it came I, David, Emperor of Pellucidar.  I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doubt if any other potentate in a world's history ever made a more
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: undignified entrance.  I landed head first on all fours, but I came
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quickly and was on my feet before the man in the dark guessed what had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: happened.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He saw me, though, when I arose and, sensing that no friend came thus
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: precipitately, turned to meet me even as I charged him.  I had my stone
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knife in my hand, and he had his.  In the darkness of the cave there
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was little opportunity for a display of science, though even at that I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: venture to say that we fought a very pretty duel.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Before I came to Pellucidar I do not recall that I ever had seen a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stone knife, and I am sure that I never fought with a knife of any
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: description; but now I do not have to take my hat off to any of them
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when it comes to wielding that primitive yet wicked weapon.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could just see Dian in the darkness, but I knew that she could not
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see my features or recognize me; and I enjoyed in anticipation, even
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: while I was fighting for her life and mine, her dear joy when she
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should discover that it was I who was her deliverer.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My opponent was large, but he also was active and no mean knife-man.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He caught me once fairly in the shoulder--I carry the scar yet, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shall carry it to the grave.  And then he did a  foolish thing, for as
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I leaped back to gain a second  in which to calm the shock of the wound
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he rushed after me and tried to clinch.  He rather neglected his knife
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the moment in his greater desire to get his hands on me.  Seeing
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the opening, I swung my left fist fairly to the point of his jaw.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Down he went.  Before ever he could scramble up again I was on him and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had buried my knife in his heart.  Then I stood up--and there was Dian
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: facing me and peering at me through the dense gloom.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You are not Juag!" she exclaimed.  "Who are you?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I took a step toward her, my arms outstretched.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is I, Dian," I said.  "It is David."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At the sound of my voice she gave a little cry in which tears were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mingled--a pathetic little cry that told me all without words how far
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hope had gone from her--and then she ran forward and threw herself in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my arms.  I covered her perfect lips and her beautiful face with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kisses, and stroked her thick black hair, and told her again and again
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what she already knew--what she had known for years--that I loved her
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: better than all else which two worlds had to offer.  We couldn't devote
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: much time, though, to the happiness of love-making, for we were in the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: midst of enemies who might discover us at any moment.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I drew her into the adjoining cave.  Thence we made our way to the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mouth of the cave that had given me entrance to the cliff.  Here I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reconnoitered for a moment, and seeing the coast clear, ran swiftly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forth with Dian at my side.  We dodged around the cliff-end, then
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: paused for an instant, listening.  No sound reached our ears to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indicate that any had seen us, and we moved cautiously onward along the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: way by which I had come.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we went Dian told me that her captors had informed her how close I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had come in search of her--even to the Land of Awful Shadow--and how
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one of Hooja's men who knew me had discovered me asleep and robbed me
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of all my possessions.  And then how Hooja had sent four others to find
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me and take me prisoner.  But these men, she said, had not yet
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returned, or at least she had not heard of their return.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Nor will you ever," I responded, "for they have gone to that place
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whence none ever returns." I then related my adventure with these four.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We had come almost to the cliff-edge where Juag should be awaiting us
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when we saw two men walking rapidly toward the same spot from another
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: direction.  They did not see us, nor did they see Juag, whom I now
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovered hiding behind a low bush close to the verge of the precipice
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which drops into the sea at this point.  As quickly as possible,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without exposing ourselves too much to the enemy, we hastened forward
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that we might reach Juag as quickly as they.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But they noticed him first and immediately charged him, for one of them
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had been his guard, and they had both been sent to search for him, his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escape having been discovered between the time he left the cave and the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time when I reached it.  Evidently they had wasted precious moments
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looking for him in other portions of the mesa.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I saw that the two of them were rushing him, I called out to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attract their attention to the fact that they had more than a single
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man to cope with.  They paused at the sound of my voice and looked
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When they discovered Dian and me they exchanged a few words, and one of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them continued toward Juag while the other turned upon us.  As he came
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nearer I saw that he carried in his hand one of my six-shooters, but he
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was holding it by the barrel, evidently mistaking it for some sort of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warclub or tomahawk.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could scarce refrain a grin when I thought of the wasted
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possibilities of that deadly revolver in the hands of an untutored
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warrior of the stone age.  Had he but reversed it and pulled the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trigger he might still be alive; maybe he is for all I know, since I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did not kill him then.  When he was about twenty feet from me I flung
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my javelin with a quick movement that I had learned from Ghak.  He
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ducked to avoid it, and instead of receiving it in his heart, for which

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it was intended, he got it on the side of the head.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Down he went all in a heap.  Then I glanced toward Juag.  He was having
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a most exciting time.  The fellow pitted against Juag was a veritable
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: villainous-looking knife that might have been designed for butchering

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mastodons.  Step by step, he was forcing Juag back toward the edge of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliff with a fiendish cunning that permitted his adversary no
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chance to side-step the terrible consequences of retreat in this
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: direction.  I saw quickly that in another moment Juag must deliberately
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hurl himself to death over the precipice or be pushed over by his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: foeman.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And as I saw Juag's predicament I saw, too, in the same instant, a way
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to relieve him.  Leaping quickly to the side of the fellow I had just

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: take, and I realized it in the instant that I threw the gun up from my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hip and pulled the trigger.  There was no time to aim.  Juag was upon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beating at him furiously with the heavy knife.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar

text: He cast a single affrighted glance in my direction--never before, of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: course, had he heard the report of a firearm--and with a howl of dismay
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he, too, turned and plunged headforemost from sight.  Horror-struck, I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hastened to the brink of the abyss just in time to see two splashes
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the surface of the little cove below.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For an instant I stood there watching with Dian at my side.  Then, to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my utter amazement, I saw Juag rise to the surface and swim strongly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward the boat.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The fellow had dived that incredible distance and come up unharmed!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I called to him to await us below, assuring him that he need have no
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fear of my weapon, since it would harm only my enemies.  He shook his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: head and mut-tered something which I could not hear at so great a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: distance; but when I pushed him he promised to wait for us.  At the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: same instant Dian caught my arm and pointed toward the village.  My
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shot had brought a crowd of natives on the run toward us.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The fellow whom I had stunned with my javelin had regained
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: consciousness and scrambled to his feet.  He was now racing as fast as
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he could go back toward his people.  It looked mighty dark for Dian and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me with that ghastly descent between us and even the beginnings of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: liberty, and a horde of savage enemies advancing at a rapid run.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There was but one hope.  That was to get Dian started for the bottom
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without delay.  I took her in my arms just for an instant--I felt,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: somehow, that it might be for the last time.  For the life of me I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: couldn't see how both of us could escape.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I asked her if she could make the descent alone--if she were not
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: afraid.  She smiled up at me bravely and shrugged her shoulders.  She
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: afraid! So beautiful is she that I am always having difficulty in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remembering that she is a primitive, half-savage cave girl of the stone
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: age, and often find myself mentally limiting her capacities to those of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the effete and overcivilized beauties of the outer crust.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And you?" she asked as she swung over the edge of the cliff.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I shall follow you after I take a shot or two at our friends," I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: replied.  "I just want to give them a taste of this new medicine which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is going to cure Pellucidar of all its ills.  That will stop them long
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enough for me to join you.  Now hurry, and tell Juag to be ready to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shove off the moment I reach the boat, or the instant that it becomes
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apparent that I cannot reach it.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You, Dian, must return to Sari if anything happens to me, that you may
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: devote your life to carrying out with Perry the hopes and plans for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidar that are so dear to my heart.  Promise me, dear."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She hated to promise to desert me, nor would she; only shaking her head
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and making no move to descend.  The tribesmen were nearing us.  Juag
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was shouting up to us from below.  It was evident that he realized from
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my actions that I was attempting to persuade Dian to descend, and that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: grave danger threatened us from above.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Dive!" he cried.  "Dive!"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I looked at Dian and then down at the abyss below us. The cove appeared
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: no larger than a saucer.  How Juag ever had hit it I could not guess.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Dive!" cried Juag.  "It is the only way--there is no time to climb
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down."
title: Pellucidar

text: CHAPTER XI
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ESCAPE
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian glanced downward and shuddered.  Her tribe were hill people--they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were not accustomed to swimming other than in quiet rivers and placid
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lakelets.  It was not the steep that appalled her.  It was the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ocean--vast, mysterious, terrible.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To dive into it from this great height was beyond her.  I couldn't
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wonder, either.  To have attempted it myself seemed too preposterous
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even for thought.  Only one consideration could have prompted me to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leap headforemost from that giddy height--suicide; or at least so I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thought at the moment.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Quick!" I urged Dian.  "You cannot dive; but I can hold them until you
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reach safety."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And you?" she asked once more.  "Can you dive when they come too
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: close? Otherwise you could not escape if you waited here until I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reached the bottom."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I saw that she would not leave me unless she thought that I could make
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that frightful dive as we had seen Juag make it.  I glanced once
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: downward; then with a mental shrug I assured her that I would dive the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moment that she reached the boat.  Satisfied, she began the descent
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carefully, yet swiftly.  I watched her for a moment, my heart in my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mouth lest some slight mis-step or the slipping of a finger-hold should
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pitch her to a frightful death upon the rocks below.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then I turned toward the advancing Hoojans--"Hoosiers," Perry dubbed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them--even going so far as to christen this island where Hooja held
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sway Indiana; it is so marked now upon our maps.  They were coming on
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at a great rate.  I raised my revolver, took deliberate aim at the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: foremost warrior, and pulled the trigger.  With the bark of the gun the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fellow lunged forward.  His head doubled beneath him.  He rolled over
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and over two or three times before he came to a stop, to lie very
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quietly in the thick grass among the brilliant wild flowers.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Those behind him halted.  One of them hurled a javelin toward me, but
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it fell short--they were just beyond javelin-range.  There were two
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: armed with bows and arrows; these I kept my eyes on.  All of them
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appeared awe-struck and frightened by the sound and effect of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: firearm.  They kept looking from the corpse to me and jabbering among
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: themselves.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I took advantage of the lull in hostilities to throw a quick glance
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: over the edge toward Dian.  She was half-way down the cliff and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: progressing finely.  Then I turned back toward the enemy.  One of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bowmen was fitting an arrow to his bow.  I raised my hand.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Stop!" I cried.  "Whoever shoots at me or advances toward me I shall
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kill as I killed him!"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I pointed at the dead man.  The fellow lowered his bow.  Again there
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was animated discussion.  I could see that those who were not armed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with bows were urging something upon the two who were.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last the majority appeared to prevail, for simu-taneously the two
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: archers raised their weapons.  At the same instant I fired at one of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them, dropping him in his tracks.  The other, however, launched his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: missile, but the report of my gun had given him such a start that the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arrow flew wild above my head.  A second after and he, too, was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sprawled upon the sward with a round hole between his eyes.  It had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been a rather good shot.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I glanced over the edge again.  Dian was almost at the bottom.  I could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see Juag standing just beneath her with his hands upstretched to assist
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A sullen roar from the warriors recalled my attention toward them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They stood shaking their fists at me and yelling insults.  From the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: direction of the village I saw a single warrior coming to join them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He was a huge fellow, and when he strode among them I could tell by his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bearing and their deference toward him that he was a chieftain.  He
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: listened to all they had to tell of the happenings of the last few
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: minutes; then with a command and a roar he started for me with the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whole pack at his heels.  All they had needed had arrived--namely, a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brave leader.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had two unfired cartridges in the chambers of my gun.  I let the big
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warrior have one of them, thinking that his death would stop them all.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But I guess they were worked up to such a frenzy of rage by this time
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that nothing would have stopped them.  At any rate, they only yelled
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the louder as he fell and increased their speed toward me.  I dropped
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: another with my remaining cartridge.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then they were upon me--or almost.  I thought of my promise to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian--the awful abyss was behind me--a big devil with a huge bludgeon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in front of me.  I grasped my six-shooter by the barrel and hurled it
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: squarely in his face with all my strength.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then, without waiting to learn the effect of my throw, I wheeled, ran
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the few steps to the edge, and leaped as far out over that frightful
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chasm as I could.  I know something of diving, and all that I know I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: put into that dive, which I was positive would be my last.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For a couple of hundred feet I fell in horizontal position. The
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: momentum I gained was terrific.  I could feel the air almost as a solid
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: body, so swiftly I hurtled through it.  Then my position gradually
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: changed to the vertical, and with hands outstretched I slipped through
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the air, cleaving it like a flying arrow.  Just before I struck the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: water a perfect shower of javelins fell all about.  My enemies had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rushed to the brink and hurled their weapons after me.  By a miracle I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was untouched.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In the final instant I saw that I had cleared the rocks and was going
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to strike the water fairly.  Then I was in and plumbing the depths.  I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suppose I didn't really go very far down, but it seemed to me that I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should never stop.  When at last I dared curve my hands upward and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: divert my progress toward the surface, I thought that I should explode
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for air before I ever saw the sun again except through a swirl of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: water.  But at last my head popped above the waves, and I filled my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lungs with air.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Before me was the boat, from which Juag and Dian were clambering.  I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: couldn't understand why they were deserting it now, when we were about
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to set out for the mainland in it; but when I reached its side I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: understood.  Two heavy javelins, missing Dian and Juag by but a hair's
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: breadth, had sunk deep into the bottom of the dugout in a straight line
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with the grain of the wood, and split her almost in two from stem to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stern.  She was useless.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Juag was leaning over a near-by rock, his hand out-stretched to aid me
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in clambering to his side; nor did I lose any time in availing myself
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of his proffered assistance.  An occasional javelin was still dropping
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perilously close to us, so we hastened to draw as close as possible to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliffside, where we were comparatively safe from the missiles.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here we held a brief conference, in which it was decided that our only
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hope now lay in making for the opposite end of the island as quickly as
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we could, and utilizing the boat that I had hidden there, to continue
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our journey to the mainland.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Gathering up three of the least damaged javelins that had fallen about
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us, we set out upon our journey, keeping well toward the south side of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the island, which Juag said was less frequented by the Hoojans than the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: central portion where the river ran.  I think that this ruse must have
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thrown our pursuers off our track, since we saw nothing of them nor
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heard any sound of pursuit during the greater portion of our march the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: length of the island.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But the way Juag had chosen was rough and round-about, so that we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: consumed one or two more marches in covering the distance than if we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had followed the river.  This it was which proved our undoing.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Those who sought us must have sent a party up the river immediately
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: after we escaped; for when we came at last onto the river-trail not far
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from our destination, there can be no doubt but that we were seen by
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hoojans who were just ahead of us on the stream.  The result was that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as we were passing through a clump of bush a score of warriors leaped
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out upon us, and before we could scarce strike a blow in defense, had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disarmed and bound us.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For a time thereafter I seemed to be entirely bereft of hope.  I could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see no ray of promise in the future--only immediate death for Juag and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me, which didn't concern me much in the face of what lay in store for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Poor child! What an awful life she had led! From the moment that I had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first seen her chained in the slave caravan of the Mahars until now, a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prisoner of a no less cruel creature, I could recall but a few brief
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intervals of peace and quiet in her tempestuous existence.  Before I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had known her, Jubal the Ugly One had pursued her across a savage world
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to make her his mate.  She had eluded him, and finally I had slain him;
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but terror and privations, and exposure to fierce beasts had haunted
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her footsteps during all her lonely flight from him.  And when I had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returned to the outer world the old trials had recommenced with Hooja
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in Jubal's role.  I could almost have wished for death to vouchsafe her
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that peace which fate seemed to deny her in this life.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I spoke to her on the subject, suggesting that we expire together.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Do not fear, David," she replied.  "I shall end my life before ever
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hooja can harm me; but first I shall see that Hooja dies."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She drew from her breast a little leathern thong, to the end of which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was fastened a tiny pouch.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What have you there?" I asked.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Do you recall that time you stepped upon the thing you call viper in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: your world?" she asked.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I nodded.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The accident gave you the idea for the poisoned arrows with which we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fitted the warriors of the empire," she continued.  "And, too, it gave
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me an idea.  For a long time I have carried a viper's fang in my bosom.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It has given me strength to endure many dangers, for it has always
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: assured me immunity from the ultimate insult.  I am not ready to die
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: yet.  First let Hooja embrace the viper's fang."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So we did not die together, and I am glad now that we did not.  It is
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: always a foolish thing to contemplate suicide; for no matter how dark
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the future may appear today, tomorrow may hold for us that which will
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alter our whole life in an instant, revealing to us nothing but
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sunshine and happiness.  So, for my part, I shall always wait for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tomorrow.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In Pellucidar, where it is always today, the wait may not be so long,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and so it proved for us.  As we were passing a lofty, flat-topped hill
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through a park-like wood a perfect network of fiber ropes fell suddenly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about our guard, enmeshing them.  A moment later a horde of our
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: friends, the hairy gorilla-men, with the mild eyes and long faces of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sheep leaped among them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was a very interesting fight.  I was sorry that my bonds prevented
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me from taking part in it, but I urged on the brutemen with my voice,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and cheered old Gr-gr-gr, their chief, each time that his mighty jaws
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crunched out the life of a Hoojan.  When the battle was over we found
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that a few of our captors had escaped, but the majority of them lay
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dead about us.  The gorilla-men paid no further attention to them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Gr-gr-gr turned to me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Gr-gr-gr and all his people are your friends," he said.  "One saw the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warriors of the Sly One and followed them.  He saw them capture you,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and then he flew to the village as fast as he could go and told me all
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that he had seen.  The rest you know.  You did much for Gr-gr-gr and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Gr-gr-gr's people.  We shall always do much for you."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I thanked him; and when I had told him of our escape and our
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: number of his fierce males.  Nor were we at all loath to accept his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escort.  We found the canoe where I had hidden it, and bidding Gr-gr-gr
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mouth of the great river of which he had told me, and up which he said
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was strong upon me, arousing in me at last a determination to make the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attempt after first gaining the mainland and rectifying our
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deficiencies.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We landed several miles north of Thuria in a little cove that seemed to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: offer protection from the heavier seas which sometimes run, even upon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: these usually pacific oceans of Pellucidar.  Here I outlined to Dian
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and Juag the plans I had in mind.  They were to fit the canoe with a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: small sail, the purposes of which I had to explain to them both--since
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: neither had ever seen or heard of such a contrivance before.  Then they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were to hunt for food which we could transport with us, and prepare a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: receptacle for water.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: These two latter items were more in Juag's line, but he kept muttering
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about the sail and the wind for a long time.  I could see that he was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not even half convinced that any such ridiculous contraption could make
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a canoe move through the water.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We hunted near the coast for a while, but were not rewarded with any
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: particular luck.  Finally we decided to hide the canoe and strike
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inland in search of game.  At Juag's suggestion we dug a hole in the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sand at the upper edge of the beach and buried the craft, smoothing the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surface over nicely and throwing aside the excess material we had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: excavated.  Then we set out away from the sea.  Traveling in Thuria is
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: less arduous than under the midday sun which perpetually glares down on
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the rest of Pellucidar's surface; but it has its draw-backs, one of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which is the depressing influence exerted by the everlasting shade of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Land of Awful Shadow.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The farther inland we went the darker it became, until we were moving
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at last through an endless twilight.  The vegetation here was sparse
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and of a weird, colorless nature, though what did grow was wondrous in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shape and form.  Often we saw huge lidi, or beasts of burden, striding
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: across the dim landscape, browsing upon the grotesque vegetation or
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: drinking from the slow and sullen rivers that run down from the Lidi
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Plains to empty into the sea in Thuria.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: What we sought was either a thag--a sort of gigantic elk--or one of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: larger species of antelope, the flesh of either of which dries nicely
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the sun.  The bladder of the thag would make a fine water-bottle,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and its skin, I figured, would be a good sail.  We traveled a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: considerable distance inland, entirely crossing the Land of Awful
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Shadow and emerging at last upon that portion of the Lidi Plains which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lies in the pleasant sunlight.  Above us the pendent world revolved
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon its axis, filling me especially--and Dian to an almost equal
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: state--with wonder and insatiable curiosity as to what strange forms of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: life existed among the hills and valleys and along the seas and rivers,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which we could plainly see.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Before us stretched the horizonless expanses of vast Pellucidar, the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Lidi Plains rolling up about us, while hanging high in the heavens to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the northwest of us I thought I discerned the many towers which marked
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the entrances to the distant Mahar city, whose inhabitants preyed upon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Thurians.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Juag suggested that we travel to the northeast, where, he said, upon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the verge of the plain we would find a wooded country in which game
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should be plentiful.  Acting upon his advice, we came at last to a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forest-jungle, through which wound innumerable game-paths.  In the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: depths of this forbidding wood we came upon the fresh spoor of thag.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Shortly after, by careful stalking, we came within javelin-range of a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: small herd.  Selecting a great bull, Juag and I hurled our weapons
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: simultaneously, Dian reserving hers for an emergency.  The beast
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: staggered to his feet, bellowing.  The rest of the herd was up and away
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in an instant, only the wounded bull remaining, with lowered head and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: roving eyes searching for the foe.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then Juag exposed himself to the view of the bull--it is a part of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tactics of the hunt--while I stepped to one side behind a bush.  The
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moment that the savage beast saw Juag he charged him.  Juag ran
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: straight away, that the bull might be lured past my hiding-place.  On
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he came--tons of mighty bestial strength and rage.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian had slipped behind me.  She, too, could fight a thag should
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: emergency require.  Ah, such a girl! A rightful empress of a stone age
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by every standard which two worlds might bring to measure her!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Crashing down toward us came the bull thag, bellowing and snorting,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with the power of a hundred outer-earthly bulls.  When he was opposite
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me I sprang for the heavy mane that covered his huge neck.  To tangle
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my fingers in it was the work of but an instant.  Then I was running
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: along at the beast's shoulder.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Now, the theory upon which this hunting custom is based is one long ago
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovered by experience, and that is that a thag cannot be turned from
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his charge once he has started toward the object of his wrath, so long
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as he can still see the thing he charges.  He evidently believes that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the man clinging to his mane is attempting to restrain him from
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: overtaking his prey, and so he pays no attention to this enemy, who, of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: course, does not retard the mighty charge in the least.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Once in the gait of the plunging bull, it was but a slight matter to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vault to his back, as cavalrymen mount their chargers upon the run.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Juag was still running in plain sight ahead of the bull.  His speed was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but a trifle less than that of the monster that pursued him.  These
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidarians are almost as fleet as deer; because I am not is one
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reason that I am always chosen for the close-in work of the thag-hunt.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could not keep in front of a charging thag long enough to give the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: killer time to do his work.  I learned that the first--and last--time I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tried it.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Once astride the bull's neck, I drew my long stone knife and, setting
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the point carefully over the brute's spine, drove it home with both
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hands.  At the same instant I leaped clear of the stumbling animal.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Now, no vertebrate can progress far with a knife through his spine, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the thag is no exception to the rule.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The fellow was down instantly.  As he wallowed Juag returned, and the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: two of us leaped in when an opening afforded the opportunity and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: snatched our javelins from his side.  Then we danced about him, more
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: like two savages than anything else, until we got the opening we were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looking for, when simultaneously, our javelins pierced his wild heart,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stilling it forever.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The thag had covered considerable ground from the point at which I had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leaped upon him.  When, after despatching him, I looked back for Dian,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could see nothing of her.  I called aloud, but receiving no reply,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: set out at a brisk trot to where I had left her.  I had no difficulty
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in finding the self-same bush behind which we had hidden, but Dian was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not there.  Again and again I called, to be rewarded only by silence.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Where could she be? What could have become of her in the brief interval
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: since I had seen her standing just behind me?

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: CHAPTER XII
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: KIDNAPED!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I searched about the spot carefully.  At last I was rewarded by the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovery of her javelin, a few yards from the bush that had concealed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us from the charging thag--her javelin and the indications of a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: struggle revealed by the trampled vegetation and the overlapping
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: footprints of a woman and a man.  Filled with consternation and dismay,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I followed these latter to where they suddenly disappeared a hundred
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: yards from where the struggle had occurred.  There I saw the huge
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imprints of a lidi's feet.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The story of the tragedy was all too plain.  A Thurian had either been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: following us, or had accidentally espied Dian and taken a fancy to her.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: While Juag and I had been engaged with the thag, he had abducted her.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I ran swiftly back to where Juag was working over the kill.  As I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approached him I saw that something was wrong in this quarter as well,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the islander was standing upon the carcass of the thag, his javelin
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: poised for a throw.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I had come nearer I saw the cause of his belligerent attitude.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Just beyond him stood two large jaloks, or wolf-dogs, regarding him
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intently--a male and a female.  Their behavior was rather peculiar, for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they did not seem preparing to charge him.  Rather, they were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: contemplating him in an attitude of questioning.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Juag heard me coming and turned toward me with a grin.  These fellows
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: love excitement.  I could see by his expression that he was enjoying in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: anticipation the battle that seemed imminent.  But he never hurled his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: javelin.  A shout of warning from me stopped him, for I had seen the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remnants of a rope dangling from the neck of the male jalok.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Juag again turned toward me, but this time in surprise.  I was abreast
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him in a moment and, passing him, walked straight toward the two
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beasts.  As I did so the female crouched with bared fangs.  The male,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: however, leaped forward to meet me, not in deadly charge, but with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: every expression of delight and joy which the poor animal could exhibit.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was Raja--the jalok whose life I had saved, and whom I then had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tamed! There was no doubt that he was glad to see me.  I now think that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his seeming desertion of me had been but due to a desire to search out
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his ferocious mate and bring her, too, to live with me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When Juag saw me fondling the great beast he was filled with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: consternation, but I did not have much time to spare to Raja while my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mind was filled with the grief of my new loss.  I was glad to see the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brute, and I lost no time in taking him to Juag and making him
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: understand that Juag, too, was to be Raja's friend.  With the female
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the matter was more difficult, but Raja helped us out by growling
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: savagely at her whenever she bared her fangs against us.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I told Juag of the disappearance of Dian, and of my suspicions as to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the explanation of the catastrophe.  He wanted to start right out after
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her, but I suggested that with Raja to help me it might be as well were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he to remain and skin the thag, remove its bladder, and then return to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: where we had hidden the canoe on the beach.  And so it was arranged
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that he was to do this and await me there for a reasonable time.  I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pointed to a great lake upon the surface of the pendent world above us,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: telling him that if after this lake had appeared four times I had not
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returned to go either by water or land to Sari and fetch Ghak with an
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: army.  Then, calling Raja after me, I set out after Dian and her
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: abductor.  First I took the wolf dog to the spot where the man had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fought with Dian.  A few paces behind us followed Raja's fierce mate.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I pointed to the ground where the evidences of the struggle were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plainest and where the scent must have been strong to Raja's nostrils.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then I grasped the remnant of leash that hung about his neck and urged
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him forward upon the trail.  He seemed to understand.  With nose to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ground he set out upon his task.  Dragging me after him, he trotted
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: straight out upon the Lidi Plains, turning his steps in the direction
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the Thurian village.  I could have guessed as much!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Behind us trailed the female.  After a while she closed upon us, until
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she ran quite close to me and at Raja's side.  It was not long before
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she seemed as easy in my company as did her lord and master.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We must have covered considerable distance at a very rapid pace, for we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had reentered the great shadow, when we saw a huge lidi ahead of us,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moving leisurely across the level plain.  Upon its back were two human
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: figures.  If I could have known that the jaloks would not harm Dian I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might have turned them loose upon the lidi and its master; but I could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not know, and so dared take no chances.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: However, the matter was taken out of my hands presently when Raja
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raised his head and caught sight of his quarry.  With a lunge that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hurled me flat and jerked the leash from my hand, he was gone with the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: speed of the wind after the giant lidi and its riders.  At his side
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raced his shaggy mate, only a trifle smaller than he and no whit less
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: savage.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They did not give tongue until the lidi itself discovered them and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: broke into a lumbering, awkward, but none the less rapid gallop.  Then
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the two hound-beasts commenced to bay, starting with a low, plaintive
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: note that rose, weird and hideous, to terminate in a series of short,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sharp yelps.  I feared that it might be the hunting-call of the pack;
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and if this were true, there would be slight chance for either Dian or
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her abductor--or myself, either, as far as that was concerned.  So I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: redoubled my efforts to keep pace with the hunt; but I might as well
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have attempted to distance the bird upon the wing; as I have often
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reminded you, I am no runner.  In that instance it was just as well
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I am not, for my very slowness of foot played into my hands; while
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had I been fleeter, I might have lost Dian that time forever.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The lidi, with the hounds running close on either side, had almost
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disappeared in the darkness that enveloped the surrounding landscape,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when I noted that it was bearing toward the right.  This was accounted

text: for by the fact that Raja ran upon his left side, and unlike his mate,
title: Pellucidar

text: kept leaping for the great beast's shoulder.  The man on the lidi's
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back was prodding at the hyaenodon with his long spear, but still Raja
title: Pellucidar

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice
