title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The battle over and the prisoners disposed of and fed--and do not
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imagine that Dian, Juag, and I, as well as the two hounds were not fed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: also--I turned my attention to the fleet.  We had the feluccas close in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about the flag-ship, and with all the ceremony of a medieval potentate
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on parade I received the commanders of the forty-nine feluccas that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accompanied the flag-ship--Dian and I together--the empress and the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: emperor of Pellucidar.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was a great occasion.  The savage, bronze warriors entered into the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spirit of it, for as I learned later dear old Perry had left no
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: opportunity neglected for impressing upon them that David was emperor
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Pellucidar, and that all that they were accomplishing and all that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he was accomplishing was due to the power, and redounded to the glory
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of David.  The old man must have rubbed it in pretty strong, for those
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fierce warriors nearly came to blows in their efforts to be among the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first of those to kneel before me and kiss my hand.  When it came to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kissing Dian's I think they enjoyed it more; I know I should have.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A happy thought occurred to me as I stood upon the little deck of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Amoz with the first of Perry's primitive cannon behind me.  When Ja
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kneeled at my feet, and first to do me homage, I drew from its scabbard
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at his side the sword of hammered iron that Perry had taught him to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fashion.  Striking him lightly on the shoulder I created him king of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Anoroc.  Each captain of the forty-nine other feluccas I made a  duke.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I left it to Perry to enlighten them as to the value of the honors I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had bestowed upon them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: During these ceremonies Raja and Ranee had stood beside Dian and me.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Their bellies had been well filled, but still they had difficulty in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: permitting so much edible humanity to pass unchallenged.  It was a good
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: education for them though, and never after did they find it difficult
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to associate with the human race without arousing their appetites.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After the ceremonies were over we had a chance to talk with Perry and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ja.  The former told me that Ghak, king of Sari, had sent my letter and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: map to him by a runner, and that he and Ja had at once decided to set
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out on the completion of the fleet to ascertain the correctness of my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: theory that the Lural Az, in which the Anoroc Islands lay, was in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reality the same ocean as that which lapped the shores of Thuria under
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the name of Sojar Az, or Great Sea.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Their destination had been the island retreat of Hooja, and they had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sent word to Ghak of their plans that we might work in harmony with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them.  The tempest that had blown us off the coast of the continent had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blown them far to the south also.  Shortly before discovering us they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had come into a great group of islands, from between the largest two of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which they were sailing when they saw Hooja's fleet pursuing our dugout.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I asked Perry if he had any idea as to where we were, or in what
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: direction lay Hooja's island or the continent.  He replied by producing
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his map, on which he had carefully marked the newly discovered
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: islands--there described as the Unfriendly Isles--which showed Hooja's
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: island northwest of us about two points West.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He then explained that with compass, chronometer, log and reel, they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had kept a fairly accurate record of their course from the time they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had set out.  Four of the feluccas were equipped with these
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instruments, and all of the captains had been instructed in their use.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was very greatly surprised at the ease with which these savages had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mastered the rather intricate detail of this unusual work, but Perry
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: assured me that they were a wonderfully intelligent race, and had been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quick to grasp all that he had tried to teach them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Another thing that surprised me was the fact that so much had been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accomplished in so short a time, for I could not believe that I had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been gone from Anoroc for a sufficient period to permit of building a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fleet of fifty feluccas and mining iron ore for the cannon and balls,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to say nothing of manufacturing these guns and the crude muzzle-loading
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rifles with which every Mezop was armed, as well as the gunpowder and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ammunition they had in such ample quantities.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Time!" exclaimed Perry.  "Well, how long were you gone from Anoroc
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before we picked you up in the Sojar Az?"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That was a puzzler, and I had to admit it.  I didn't know how much time
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had elapsed and neither did Perry, for time is nonexistent in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidar.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Then, you see, David," he continued, "I had almost unbelievable
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: resources at my disposal.  The Mezops inhabiting the Anoroc Islands,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which stretch far out to sea beyond the three principal isles with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which you are familiar, number well into the millions, and by far the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: greater part of them are friendly to Ja.  Men, women, and children
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turned to and worked the moment Ja explained the nature of our
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enterprise.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And not only were they anxious to do all in their power to hasten the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: day when the Mahars should be overthrown, but--and this counted for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: most of all--they are simply ravenous for greater knowledge and for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: better ways of doing things.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The contents of the prospector set their imaginations to working
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: overtime, so that they craved to own, themselves, the knowledge which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had made it possible for other men to create and build the things which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you brought back from the outer world.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And then," continued the old man, "the element of time, or, rather,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lack of time, operated to my advantage.  There being no nights, there
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was no laying off from work--they labored incessantly stopping only to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eat and, on rare occasions, to sleep.  Once we had discovered iron ore
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we had enough mined in an incredibly short time to build a thousand
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cannon.  I had only to show them once how a thing should be done, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they would fall to work by thousands to do it.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why, no sooner had we fashioned the first muzzle-loader and they had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seen it work successfully, than fully three thousand Mezops fell to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: work to make rifles.  Of course there was much confusion and lost
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: motion at first, but eventually Ja got them in hand, detailing squads
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of them under competent chiefs to certain work.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We now have a hundred expert gun-makers.  On a little isolated isle we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have a great powder-factory.  Near the iron-mine, which is on the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mainland, is a smelter, and on the eastern shore of Anoroc, a well
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: equipped ship-yard.  All these industries are guarded by forts in which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: several cannon are mounted and where warriors are always on guard.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You would be surprised now, David, at the aspect of Anoroc.  I am
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surprised myself; it seems always to me as I compare it with the day
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I first set foot upon it from the deck of the Sari that only a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: miracle could have worked the change that has taken place."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is a miracle," I said; "it is nothing short of a miracle to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: transplant all the wondrous possibilities of the twentieth century back
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the Stone Age.  It is a miracle to think that only five hundred
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: miles of earth separate two epochs that are really ages and ages apart."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is stupendous, Perry! But still more stupendous is the power that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you and I wield in this great world.  These people look upon us as
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: little less than supermen.  We must show them that we are all of that.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We must give them the best that we have, Perry."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Yes," he agreed; "we must.  I have been thinking a great deal lately
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that some kind of shrapnel shell or explosive bomb would be a most
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: splendid innovation in their warfare.  Then there are breech-loading
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rifles and those with magazines that I must hasten to study out and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: learn to reproduce as soon as we get settled down again; and--"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Hold on, Perry!" I cried.  "I didn't mean these sorts of things at
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all.  I said that we must give them the best we have.  What we have
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: given them so far has been the worst.  We have given them war and the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: munitions of war.  In a single day we have made their wars infinitely
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more terrible and bloody than in all their past ages they have been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: able to make them with their crude, primitive weapons.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "In a period that could scarcely have exceeded two outer earthly hours,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our fleet practically annihilated the largest armada of native canoes
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that the Pellucidarians ever before had gathered together.  We
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: butchered some eight thousand warriors with the twentieth-century gifts
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we brought.  Why, they wouldn't have killed that many warriors in the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entire duration of a dozen of their wars with their own weapons!  No,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry; we've got to give them something better than scientific methods
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of killing one another."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The old man looked at me in amazement.  There was reproach in his eyes,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: too.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why, David!" he said sorrowfully.  "I thought that you would be
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pleased with what I had done.  We planned these things together, and I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: am sure that it was you who suggested practically all of it.  I have
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: done only what I thought you wished done and I have done it the best
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I know how."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I laid my hand on the old man's shoulder.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Bless your heart, Perry!" I cried.  "You've accomplished miracles.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: You have done precisely what I should have done, only you've done it
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: better.  I'm not finding fault; but I don't wish to lose sight myself,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: or let you lose sight, of the greater work which must grow out of this
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: preliminary and necessary carnage.  First we must place the empire upon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a secure footing, and we can do so only by putting the fear of us in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the hearts of our enemies; but after that--
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Ah, Perry! That is the day I look forward to! When you and I can build
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sewing-machines instead of battle-ships, harvesters of crops instead of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: harvesters of men, plow-shares and telephones, schools and colleges,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: printing-presses and paper! When our merchant marine shall ply the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great Pellucidarian seas, and cargoes of silks and typewriters and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: books shall forge their ways where only hideous saurians have held sway
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: since time began!"
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Amen!" said Perry.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And Dian, who was standing at my side, pressed my hand.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: CHAPTER XV
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: CONQUEST AND PEACE
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The fleet sailed directly for Hooja's island, coming to anchor at its
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: north-eastern extremity before the flat-topped hill that had been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hooja's stronghold.  I sent one of the prisoners ashore to demand an
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: immediate surrender; but as he told me afterward they wouldn't believe
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all that he told them, so they congregated on the cliff-top and shot
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: futile arrows at us.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In reply I had five of the feluccas cannonade them.  When they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scampered away at the sound of the terrific explosions, and at sight of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the smoke and the iron balls I landed a couple of hundred red warriors
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and led them to the opposite end of the hill into the tunnel that ran
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to its summit.  Here we met a little resistance; but a volley from the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: muzzle-loaders turned back those who disputed our right of way, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: presently we gained the mesa.  Here again we met resistance, but at
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: last the remnant of Hooja's horde surrendered.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Juag was with me, and I lost no time in returning to him and his tribe
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the hilltop that had been their ancestral home for ages until they were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: robbed of it by Hooja.  I created a kingdom of the island, making Juag
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: king there.  Before we sailed I went to Gr-gr-gr, chief of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beast-men, taking Juag with me.  There the three of us arranged a code
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of laws that would permit the brute-folk and the human beings of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: island to live in peace and harmony.  Gr-gr-gr sent his son with me
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back to Sari, capital of my empire, that he might learn the ways of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: human beings.  I have hopes of turning this race into the greatest
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: agriculturists of Pellucidar.  When I returned to the fleet I found
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that one of the islanders of Juag's tribe, who had been absent when we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arrived, had just returned from the mainland with the news that a great
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: army was encamped in the Land of Awful Shadow, and that they were
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: threatening Thuria.  I lost no time in weighing anchors and setting out
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the continent, which we reached after a short and easy voyage.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: From the deck of the Amoz I scanned the shore through the glasses that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry had brought with him.  When we were close enough for the glasses
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to be of value I saw that there was indeed a vast concourse of warriors
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entirely encircling the walled-village of Goork, chief of the Thurians.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we approached smaller objects became distinguishable.  It was then
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I discovered numerous flags and pennants floating above the army
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the besiegers.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I called Perry and passed the glasses to him.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Ghak of Sari," I said.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry looked through the lenses of a moment, and then turned to me with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a smile.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The red, white, and blue of the empire," he said.  "It is indeed your
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: majesty's army."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It soon became apparent that we had been sighted by those on shore, for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a great multitude of warriors had congregated along the beach watching
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us.  We came to anchor as close in as we dared, which with our light
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feluccas was within easy speaking-distance of the shore.  Ghak was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there and his eyes were mighty wide, too; for, as he told us later,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though he knew this must be Perry's fleet it was so wonderful to him
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that he could not believe the testimony of his own eyes even while he
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was watching it approach.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To give the proper effect to our meeting I commanded that each felucca
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fire twenty-one guns as a salute to His Majesty Ghak, King of Sari.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Some of the gunners, in the exuberance of their enthusiasm, fired solid
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shot; but fortunately they had sufficient good judg-ment to train their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pieces on the open sea, so no harm was done.  After this we landed--an
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arduous task since each felucca carried but a single light dugout.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I learned from Ghak that the Thurian chieftain, Goork, had been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inclined to haughtiness, and had told Ghak, the Hairy One, that he knew
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nothing of me and cared less; but I imagine that the sight of the fleet
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the sound of the guns brought him to his senses, for it was not
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long before he sent a deputation to me, inviting me to visit him in his
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: village.  Here he apologized for the treatment he had accorded me, very
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gladly swore allegiance to the empire, and received in return the title
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of king.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We remained in Thuria only long enough to arrange the treaty with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Goork, among the other details of which was his promise to furnish the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imperial army with a thousand lidi, or Thurian beasts of burden, and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: drivers for them.  These were to accompany Ghak's army back to Sari by
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: land, while the fleet sailed to the mouth of the great river from which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian, Juag, and I had been blown.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The voyage was uneventful.  We found the river easily, and sailed up it
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for many miles through as rich and wonderful a plain as I have ever
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seen.  At the head of navigation we disembarked, leaving a sufficient
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: guard for the feluccas, and marched the remaining distance to Sari.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ghak's army, which was composed of warriors of all the original tribes
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the federation, showing how successful had been his efforts to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rehabilitate the empire, marched into Sari some time after we arrived.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With them were the thousand lidi from Thuria.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At a council of the kings it was decided that we should at once
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: commence the great war against the Mahars, for these haughty reptiles
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: presented the greatest obstacle to human progress within Pellucidar.  I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: laid out a plan of campaign which met with the enthusiastic
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indorsement of the kings.  Pursuant to it, I at once despatched fifty
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lidi to the fleet with orders to fetch fifty cannon to Sari.  I also
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ordered the fleet to proceed at once to Anoroc, where they were to take
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aboard all the rifles and ammunition that had been completed since
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their departure, and with a full complement of men to sail along the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: coast in an attempt to find a passage to the inland sea near which lay
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Mahars' buried city of Phutra.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ja was sure that a large and navigable river connected the sea of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Phutra with the Lural Az, and that, barring accident, the fleet would
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be before Phutra as soon as the land forces were.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last the great army started upon its march.  There were warriors
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from every one of the federated kingdoms.  All were armed either with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bow and arrows or muzzle-loaders, for nearly the entire Mezop
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: contingent had been enlisted for this march, only sufficient having
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been left aboard the feluccas to man them properly.  I divided the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forces into divisions, regiments, battalions, companies, and even to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: platoons and sections, appointing the full complement of officers and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noncommissioned officers.  On the long march I schooled them in their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: duties, and as fast as one learned I sent him among the others as a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: teacher.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Each regiment was made up of about a thousand bowmen, and to each was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: temporarily attached a company of Mezop musketeers and a battery of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: artillery--the latter, our naval guns, mounted upon the broad backs of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the mighty lidi.  There was also one full regiment of Mezop musketeers
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and a regiment of primitive spearmen.  The rest of the lidi that we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brought with us were used for baggage animals and to transport our
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: women and children, for we had brought them with us, as it was our
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intention to march from one Mahar city to another until we had subdued
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: every Mahar nation that menaced the safety of any kingdom of the empire.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Before we reached the plain of Phutra we were discovered by a company
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Sagoths, who at first stood to give battle; but upon seeing the vast
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: numbers of our army they turned and fled toward Phutra.  The result of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this was that when we came in sight of the hundred towers which mark
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the entrances to the buried city we found a great army of Sagoths and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Mahars lined up to give us battle.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At a thousand yards we halted, and, placing our artillery upon a slight
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eminence at either flank, we commenced to drop solid shot among them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ja, who was chief artillery officer, was in command of this branch of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the service, and he did some excellent work, for his Mezop gunners had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: become rather proficient by this time.  The Sagoths couldn't stand much
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of this sort of warfare, so they charged us, yelling like fiends.  We
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: let them come quite close, and then the musketeers who formed the first
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: line opened up on them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The slaughter was something frightful, but still the remnants of them
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kept on coming until it was a matter of hand-to-hand fighting.  Here
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our spearmen were of value, as were also the crude iron swords with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which most of the imperial warriors were armed.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We lost heavily in the encounter after the Sagoths reached us; but they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were absolutely exterminated--not one remained even as a prisoner.  The
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Mahars, seeing how the battle was going, had hastened to the safety of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their buried city.  When we had overcome their gorilla-men we followed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: after them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But here we were doomed to defeat, at least temporarily; for no sooner
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had the first of our troops descended into the subterranean avenues
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than many of them came stumbling and fighting their way back to the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surface, half-choked by the fumes of some deadly gas that the reptiles
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had liberated upon them.  We lost a number of men here.  Then I sent
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for Perry, who had remained discreetly in the rear, and had him
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: construct a little affair that I had had in my mind against the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possibility of our meeting with a check at the entrances to the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: underground city.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Under my direction he stuffed one of his cannon full of powder, small
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bullets, and pieces of stone, almost to the muzzle.  Then he plugged
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the muzzle tight with a cone-shaped block of wood, hammered and jammed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in as tight as it could be.  Next he inserted a long fuse.  A dozen men
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rolled the cannon to the top of the stairs leading down into the city,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first removing it from its carriage.  One of them then lit the fuse and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the whole thing was given a shove down the stairway, while the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: detachment turned and scampered to a safe distance.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For what seemed a very long time nothing happened.  We had commenced to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: think that the fuse had been put out while the piece was rolling down
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the stairway, or that the Mahars had guessed its purpose and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extinguished it themselves, when the ground about the entrance rose
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suddenly into the air, to be followed by a terrific explosion and a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: burst of smoke and flame that shot high in company with dirt, stone,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and fragments of cannon.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry had been working on two more of these giant bombs as soon as the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first was completed.  Presently we launched these into two of the other
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entrances.  They were all that were required, for almost immediately
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: after the third explosion a stream of Mahars broke from the exits
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: furthest from us, rose upon their wings, and soared northward.  A
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hundred men on lidi were despatched in pursuit, each lidi carrying two
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: riflemen in addition to its driver.  Guessing that the inland sea,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which lay not far north of Phutra, was their destination, I took a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: couple of regiments and followed.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A low ridge intervenes between the Phutra plain where the city lies,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the inland sea where the Mahars were wont to disport themselves in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cool waters.  Not until we had topped this ridge did we get a view
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the sea.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then we beheld a scene that I shall never forget so long as I may live.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Along the beach were lined up the troop of lidi, while a hundred yards
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from shore the surface of the water was black with the long snouts and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cold, reptilian eyes of the Mahars.  Our savage Mezop riflemen, and the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shorter, squatter, white-skinned Thurian drivers, shading their eyes
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with their hands, were gazing seaward beyond the Mahars, whose eyes
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were fastened upon the same spot.  My heart leaped when I discovered
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that which was chaining the attention of them all.  Twenty graceful
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feluccas were moving smoothly across the waters of the sea toward the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reptilian horde!
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The sight must have filled the Mahars with awe and consternation, for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: never had they seen the like of these craft before.  For a time they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seemed unable to do aught but gaze at the approaching fleet; but when
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Mezops opened on them with their muskets the reptiles swam rapidly
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the direction of the feluccas, evidently thinking that these would
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prove the easier to overcome.  The commander of the fleet permitted
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them to approach within a hundred yards.  Then he opened on them with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all the cannon that could be brought to bear, as well as with the small
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arms of the sailors.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A great many of the reptiles were killed at the first volley.  They
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wavered for a moment, then dived; nor did we see them again for a long
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But finally they rose far out beyond the fleet, and when the feluccas
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: came about and pursued them they left the water and flew away toward
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the north.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Following the fall of Phutra I visited Anoroc, where I found the people
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: busy in the shipyards and the factories that Perry had established.  I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovered something, too, that he had not told me of--something that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seemed infinitely more promising than the powder-factory or the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arsenal.  It was a young man poring over one of the books I had brought
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back from the outer world! He was sitting in the log cabin that Perry
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had had built to serve as his sleeping quarters and office.  So
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: absorbed was he that he did not notice our entrance.  Perry saw the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: look of astonishment in my eyes and smiled.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I started teaching him the alphabet when we first reached the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prospector, and were taking out its contents," he explained.  "He was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: much mystified by the books and anxious to know of what use they were.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I explained he asked me to teach him to read, and so I worked with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him whenever I could.  He is very intelligent and learns quickly.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Before I left he had made great progress, and as soon as he is
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: qualified he is going to teach others to read.  It was mighty hard work
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: getting started, though, for everything had to be translated into
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pellucidarian.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It will take a long time to solve this problem, but I think that by
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: teaching a number of them to read and write English we shall then be
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: able more quickly to give them a written language of their own."
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And this was the nucleus about which we were to build our great system
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of schools and colleges--this almost naked red warrior, sitting in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry's little cabin upon the island of Anoroc, picking out words
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: letter by letter from a work on intensive farming.  Now we have--
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But I'll get to all that before I finish.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: While we were at Anoroc I accompanied Ja in an expedition to South
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Island, the southernmost of the three largest which form the Anoroc
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: group--Perry had given it its name--where we made peace with the tribe
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there that had for long been hostile toward Ja.  They were now glad
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enough to make friends with him and come into the federation.  From
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there we sailed with sixty-five feluccas for distant Luana, the main
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: island of the group where dwell the hereditary enemies of Anoroc.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Twenty-five of the feluccas were of a new and larger type than those
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with which Ja and Perry had sailed on the occasion when they chanced to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: find and rescue Dian and me.  They were longer, carried much larger
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sails, and were considerably swifter.  Each carried four guns instead
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of two, and these were so arranged that one or more of them could be
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brought into action no matter where the enemy lay.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Luana group lies just beyond the range of vision from the mainland.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The largest island of it alone is visible from Anoroc; but when we
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: neared it we found that it comprised many beautiful islands, and that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they were thickly populated.  The Luanians had not, of course, been
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ignorant of all that had been going on in the domains of their nearest
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and dearest enemies.  They knew of our feluccas and our guns, for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: several of their riding-parties had had a taste of both.  But their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: principal chief, an old man, had never seen either.  So, when he
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sighted us, he put out to overwhelm us, bringing with him a fleet of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about a hundred large war-canoes, loaded to capacity with javelin-armed
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warriors.  It was pitiful, and I told Ja as much.  It seemed a shame to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: massacre these poor fellows if there was any way out of it.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To my surprise Ja felt much as I did.  He said he had always hated to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: war with other Mezops when there were so many alien races to fight
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: against.  I suggested that we hail the chief and request a parley; but
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when Ja did so the old fool thought that we were afraid, and with loud
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cries of exultation urged his warriors upon us.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So we opened up on them, but at my suggestion centered our fire upon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the chief's canoe.  The result was that in about thirty seconds there
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was nothing left of that war dugout but a handful of splinters, while
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: its crew--those who were not killed--were struggling in the water,
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: battling with the myriad terrible creatures that had risen to devour
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We saved some of them, but the majority died just as had Hooja and the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crew of his canoe that time our second shot capsized them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Again we called to the remaining warriors to enter into a parley with
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us; but the chief's son was there and he would not, now that he had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seen his father killed.  He was all for revenge.  So we had to open up
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on the brave fellows with all our guns; but it didn't last long at
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that, for there chanced to be wiser heads among the Luanians than their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chief or his son had possessed.  Presently, an old warrior who
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: commanded one of the dugouts surrendered.  After that they came in one
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by one until all had laid their weapons upon our decks.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then we called together upon the flag-ship all our captains, to give
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the affair greater weight and dignity, and all the principal men of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Luana.  We had conquered them, and they expected either death or
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slavery; but they deserved neither, and I told them so.  It is always
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my habit here in Pellucidar to impress upon these savage people that
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mercy is as noble a quality as physical bravery, and that next to the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: men who fight shoulder to shoulder with one, we should honor the brave
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: men who fight against us, and if we are victorious, award them both the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mercy and honor that are their due.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: By adhering to this policy I have won to the federation many great and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noble peoples, who under the ancient traditions of the inner world
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would have been massacred or enslaved after we had conquered them; and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thus I won the Luanians.  I gave them their freedom, and returned their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weapons to them after they had sworn loyalty to me and friendship and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: peace with Ja, and I made the old fellow, who had had the good sense to
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surrender, king of Luana, for both the old chief and his only son had
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: died in the battle.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I sailed away from Luana she was included among the kingdoms of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the empire, whose boundaries were thus pushed eastward several hundred
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: miles.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We now returned to Anoroc and thence to the mainland, where I again
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: took up the campaign against the Mahars, marching from one great buried
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: city to another until we had passed far north of Amoz into a country
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: where I had never been.  At each city we were victorious, killing or
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: capturing the Sagoths and driving the Mahars further away.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I noticed that they always fled toward the north.  The Sagoth prisoners
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we usually found quite ready to trans-fer their allegiance to us, for
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they are little more than brutes, and when they found that we could
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fill their stomachs and give them plenty of fighting, they were nothing
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loath to march with us against the next Mahar city and battle with men
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of their own race.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thus we proceeded, swinging in a great half-circle north and west and
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: south again until we had come back to the edge of the Lidi Plains north
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Thuria.  Here we overcame the Mahar city that had ravaged the Land
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Awful Shadow for so many ages.  When we marched on to Thuria, Goork
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and his people went mad with joy at the tidings we brought them.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: During this long march of conquest we had passed through seven
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: countries, peopled by primitive human tribes who had not yet heard of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the federation, and succeeded in joining them all to the empire.  It
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was noticeable that each of these peoples had a Mahar city situated
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: near by, which had drawn upon them for slaves and human food for so
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: many ages that not even in legend had the population any folk-tale
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which did not in some degree reflect an inherent terror of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reptilians.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In each of these countries I left an officer and warriors to train them
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in military discipline, and prepare them to receive the arms that I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intended furnishing them as rapidly as Perry's arsenal could turn them
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out, for we felt that it would be a long, long time before we should
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see the last of the Mahars.  That they had flown north but temporarily
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until we should be gone with our great army and terrifying guns I was
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: positive, and equally sure was I that they would presently return.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The task of ridding Pellucidar of these hideous creatures is one which
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in all probability will never be entirely completed, for their great
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cities must abound by the hundreds and thousands in the far-distant
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lands that no subject of the empire has ever laid eyes upon.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But within the present boundaries of my domain there are now none left
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I know of, for I am sure we should have heard indirectly of any
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great Mahar city that had escaped us, although of course the imperial
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: army has by no means covered the vast area which I now rule.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After leaving Thuria we returned to Sari, where the seat of government
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is located.  Here, upon a vast, fertile plateau, overlooking the great
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gulf that runs into the continent from the Lural Az, we are building
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the great city of Sari.  Here we are erecting mills and factories.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here we are teaching men and women the rudiments of agriculture.  Here
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry has built the first printing-press, and a dozen young Sarians are
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: teaching their fellows to read and write the language of Pellucidar.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We have just laws and only a few of them.  Our people are happy because
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they are always working at something which they enjoy.  There is no
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: money, nor is any money value placed upon any commodity.  Perry and I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were as one in resolving that the root of all evil should not be
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: introduced into Pellucidar while we lived.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A man may exchange that which he produces for something which he
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: desires that another has produced; but he cannot dispose of the thing
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he thus acquires.  In other words, a commodity ceases to have pecuniary
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: value the instant that it passes out of the hands of its producer.  All
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: excess reverts to government; and, as this represents the production of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the people as a government, government may dispose of it to other
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: peoples in exchange for that which they produce.  Thus we are
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: establishing a trade between kingdoms, the profits from which go to the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: betterment of the people--to building factories for the manufacture of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: agricultural implements, and machinery for the various trades we are
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gradually teaching the people.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Already Anoroc and Luana are vying with one another in the excellence
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the ships they build.  Each has several large ship-yards.  Anoroc
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: makes gunpowder and mines iron ore, and by means of their ships they
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carry on a very lucrative trade with Thuria, Sari, and Amoz.  The
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thurians breed lidi, which, having the strength and intelligence of an
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: elephant, make excellent draft animals.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Around Sari and Amoz the men are domesticating the great striped
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: antelope, the meat of which is most delicious.  I am sure that it will
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not be long before they will have them broken to harness and saddle.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The horses of Pellucidar are far too diminutive for such uses, some
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: species of them being little larger than fox-terriers.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Dian and I live in a great palace overlooking the gulf.  There is no
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: glass in our windows, for we have no windows, the walls rising but a
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: few feet above the floor-line, the rest of the space being open to the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ceilings; but we have a roof to shade us from the perpetual noon-day
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sun.  Perry and I decided to set a style in architecture that would not
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: curse future generations with the white plague, so we have plenty of
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ventilation.  Those of the people who prefer, still inhabit their
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: caves, but many are building houses similar to ours.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At Greenwich we have located a town and an observatory--though there is
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nothing to observe but the stationary sun directly overhead.  Upon the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: edge of the Land of Awful Shadow is another observatory, from which the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time is flashed by wireless to every corner of the empire twenty-four
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: times a day.  In addition to the wireless, we have a small telephone
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: system in Sari.  Everything is yet in the early stages of development;
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but with the science of the outer-world twentieth century to draw upon
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we are making rapid progress, and with all the faults and errors of the
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: outer world to guide us clear of dangers, I think that it will not be
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long before Pellucidar will become as nearly a Utopia as one may expect
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to find this side of heaven.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Perry is away just now, laying out a railway-line from Sari to Amoz.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There are immense anthracite coal-fields at the head of the gulf not
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: far from Sari, and the railway will tap these.  Some of his students
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are working on a locomotive now.  It will be a strange sight to see an
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: iron horse puffing through the primeval jungles of the stone age, while
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cave bears, saber-toothed tigers, mastodons and the countless other
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terrible creatures of the past look on from their tangled lairs in
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wide-eyed astonishment.
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We are very happy, Dian and I, and I would not return to the outer
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world for all the riches of all its princes.  I am content here.  Even
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without my imperial powers and honors I should be content, for have I
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not that greatest of all treasures, the love of a good woman--my
title: Pellucidar
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wondrous empress, Dian the Beautiful?
